Finally, the technician arrives and he says that there's not much he can do because activations are handled over the phone.  But, he used his hand-held device to again restart my modem.  Bam -- the phone worked.  So, I don't know what the problem was or what fixed it, but it just started working.  I can say with all certainty that the CM1150V restarts faster than any cable modem I've ever had.  I give the device 5 stars because it's fast, has a clean UI and will save me money in the long run. I give Comcast 0 stars for making it hard, once again, to use your own device.
title: Prepare Yourself for Endless Hours on the Phone with Comcast Support

author: Jarrett S.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2020
review_content: Needed something to do the job! Fantastic! It's fast enough to handle the internet speed and our throughput (upload/download). No latency, it goes! No cons for this device as there are none. My pet peeve with any device is for consistent resets...I can't remember the last time I had to reset it for an issue...it must have been 6 months ago when I actually remembered to do it so that it can start fresh again. Definitely recommended!
title: Needed something to do the job! Fantastic!

author: Trysta
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2020
review_content: I think as many others have reported, that our xfinity internet speeds had slowed down to nearly unusable. It would be intermittent but mostly well below 30 mbps, with the upload speed not even reaching 1 mbps. I even exchanged their modem for the newer one, and upgraded my speed, all to no avail. After countless hours of chat, phone calls, resetting the system, etc., I had to take things into my own hands. The last thing I could possibly try was purchasing our own modem. I had to get one with voice capacity that was compatible with xfinity and this was the only one. I opted for the faster speed capacity as our plan dictated. I was a little annoyed it did not come with built-in wifi. I mean, who even uses only ethernet? I decided to go with the Orbi system for the wi-fi. The xfi app wouldn't let me hook up the modem as it said the MAC couldn't be found, so I had to contact someone from comcast to do this, and that was the only downfall. I hooked the Orbi up easily afterwards, and checked my speed and it was over 340 mbps! Our laptop gets over 450! So, I would definitely say it had something to do with the comcast-owned modem, and possibly them being able to regulate the speed. It could be linked to the built-in hotspot capacity, even though I shut it off online and in my wi-fi settings. I also feel glad not having to pay them every month for a crappy modem :)
title: Yay! Seemed to have solved my problems (knock on wood!)

author: Mandini 99
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2019
review_content: We purchased this modem 7 months ago in April 2018 We started noticing that our Internet wasn't working at random times throughout the day. Now in January 2019 it stopped working one day. My husband thought it was dead. I took a chance and plugt the router cable up to it and it came on. I ended up finding a older Netgear cord that was compatible to use until we can replace this modem. Either the modem or the cord is defective. Since replacing the cord it works a little more consistent been we still have trouble streaming TV shows.My husband works for home and the modem has been so unreliable that he has had to go to a coffee shop or a relatives house to work. We hope we can find a more reliable modem router combo for our next purchase.
title: Didn't last

author: qualified man
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2019
review_content: cm1000 (not v2)purchased this modem in march 2018, and did not get around to using it until about 3months ago.  it worked great.  in fact, i had line interference issues that my old motorolla modem could no longer cope with (motorolla modem worked great for years, but eventually crapped out).  this netgear modem worked flawlessly until today.  all lights are flashing green, and no connection to internet.  i tried connecting directly to it via pc (instead of through router), and it did not recognize that anything was being connected.  consequently, i could not get to any of the setup or status pages on the modem.  bit of a bummer given the price.  not sure i can recommend given my experience of a very short useful life.edit: reducing to 1 star.  modem was first turned on on march 25, 2019; it's now june 14, 2019 and modem is not working.  i called their support, and got to speak to a real human (a plus), but this human barely spoke english, could not understand the network topography i was describing (hardwire to modem from laptop that's also connected to wireless through a different, working modem).  i spent 50 minutes on the phone with her, and all we got to do is turn it on and off once.  then, after 50 minutes of mumbling, putting me on hold, and asking me to call my isp, she informed me that i would have to pay for support.  total waste of money and time.  move on from this one, folks.
title: great while it lasted - less than 3 months

author: SunDog2710
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 17, 2019
review_content: I'm using Comcast in Richmond TX. My paid service is 400Mbps, and I'm not getting much higher, so can't say if this is a screamer, but haven't had any problems so far. It was easy to setup.UPDATE 1: There is a lot of construction in our development. Comcast Xfinity service has been intermittent on many days. Restarting the modem does not help, either using the power switch, or by having Xfinity do it thru an automated phone call, via tech support, or thru their Xfinity My Account (XMA) app. You have to actually call in and get tech support to REFRESH the modem (haven't got a sense of what that actually is). This is not available as an option in the XMA app for end-user-owned modems. Also, they push out the firmware updates, which I am ok with, but Xfinity tech support also says that they don't "touch" our modems. So, we paid $250 for basically (or as Netgear tech support put it) a "dumb" plug-n-play modem that can't really be controlled by Xfinity (or yourself), other than RESTART and REFRESH, for which you have to call in to initiate. They also cannot read the logs to see why the modem is having problems. At $10/month, just get the Xfinity XB6. If I could return this one, I would!UPDATE 2: It does not have the ability to talk to the XMA app for diagnostics and actions. There is a disconnect between Netgear and Xfinity and the customer is getting shafted. I've arranged to return the modem, if the tech guy brings it. Since I'm out of the 30 day period, I'm out ~$60 after 2.5 months of use.
title: Works as stated, but really not Xfinity compliant for diagnostics, if u have connection issues.

author: Anthony
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2019
review_content: This device could not process the 1 gig bps bandwidth as specified.  After self-installation this device and accomplished the Cox Communications upgrade to 1 Gigablast service, I was frustrated with only receiving 300 Mbps downlink to this modem after a dozen times of speed testing.  I finally had to pay a Cox technician to troubleshoot my setup.  After a couple hours of tracing the 1 gig signal successfully, he determined to replace the modem (he used Arris TM-3402A).  Finally, we saw the 915 MBPS downlink at the output of the Arris modem.  All that frustration, time and cost cause by this bad modem.
title: Did not process the 1 Gig bps bandwidth

author: Alize-LowRod
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2018
review_content: I got this set up and installed on 9/2/2018.  Install was supper easy, and I love the space saving size of it. (the Netgear CM500-1AZNAS) I got it as a package deal with the Netgear R6700 Nighthawk AC1750. I have Xfinity at home and it hooked up with out any issues. Got it to replace the set up I was renting from Xfinity to try and save some money month to month. And to be honest, This set up works about 50% better then the set up they had me renting. The range is much better and no lag. Where the one they had me renting had poor range and lots of lag. They tried to say it was because I have a brick house and it made it hard for the Wifi to get around it. This Netgear set up has no issues with getting all thru the house and even all the way out to the pool in our back yard that is just over 100ft from the set up. I also LOVE the settings for parental controls that is built into the 2nd half of this package deal, on the Netgear R6700 Nighthawk AC1750. Supper easy to set up and blocking the kids from things that are not in their age range and fine toning it as you see their browsing history it stores for at least a few days...  Vary happy with it and the package deal. (Will Update If anything changes, have only had about 12 days now.)
title: Easy To Install and space saving

author: Boog
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2020
review_content: We had already been using our own nighthawk modem for over a year. We decided to upgrade to gigabit and realized we needed this docsis 3.1 modem for it. Bought this one and it would not work. We spent a whole day checking and resetting everything. Comcast said it was our fault, netgear said it was comcast's fault. I direct plugged a laptop in to configure it and it only connected once for a short time. Figured it was broken, got it exchanged, and the second one did the same thing. Tried everything possible and it would not work in any way. They said it detected something was there but not responding. Hooked our old one back up and we had internet again in a few minutes, no problem. No gigabit for us i guess.
title: Didn't work twice

author: Russell Norton
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2019
review_content: 2019-08-21, 14:39:53 Critical (3) Started Unicast Maintenance Ranging - No Response received - T3 time-out;2019-08-20, 23:22:28 Error (4) DHCP RENEW WARNING - Field invalid in response v4 option;2019-08-20, 11:57:47 Critical (3) Started Unicast Maintenance Ranging - No Response received - T3 time-out;2019-08-20, 10:12:27 Notice (6) CM-STATUS message sent. title: regularly has technical issues and i dont have the time to troubleshoot needy tech

author: Kyle
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2019
review_content: This is one of the best modems currently on the market. Works great with higher speed internet services. Gig speeds are a go with this guy. Also, uses Broadcom chipset, much better than intel puma’s that are in a lot of other products. This device does not have WiFi nor would I have bought it if it had. Not a big fan of the combos modems.  For WiFi, you will need a dedicated wireless router for that part of the service. I’d recommend orbi and most nighthawks depending on your needs, size and budget. I am a seasoned cable repair/ install tech and I ve seen some reviews that say this is a bad product. I’d highly recommend if you have issues to get a technician from your internet service provider to trouble shoot your home cable system and network set up. Potentially minor cable issues here and there can add up, so it’s worth a call even if it’s a charge for them to repair any issues they may detect. Lastly my only regret was buying this in Dec 2018. I had been waiting patiently for a docsis 3.1 internet and telephone service capable modem but decided not to past up on a holiday sale. Current set up I have is my own modem for internet and a leased modem for telephone service only. So, a month or so later (2019) that’s exactly what netgear released but I was unable to return my modem to buy one of those because the return policy expired after 30 days. Guess I’ll have to wait a while for this one to pay its self off before I get that other model I believe is the docsis 3.1/telephone 1200 model number. So if you get both internet and telephone you will want that model not this one ( model 1000 does internet only).
title: Higher end modem with good performance and guts!

author: Dennis
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2019
review_content: My comments are on the CM1150V modem, I purchased it after 1st having the Xfinity installer certify my home was ready for 1GB service using their provided Xfinity modem w/voice.  The install went smooth except for the voice.  Xfinity agent kept sending downstreams to the modem, but Line 1 would remain Disabled for some reason.  Kept switching modems back and forth to isolate the problem.  I tried calling Netgear for help, that was a waste of  time.  Even though the Netgear kept error messages logged, neither Xfinity or Netgear agents asked to see them.  After many trials, Xfinity got my voice working properly.  As for speed, I tested it with the speedtest.  This modem performed slower than the Xfinity modem, but at least the monthly rental charge will come off my bill.
title: It didn't work right out of the box.

author: BobK
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2019
review_content: I bought this internet/voice gateway to replace the unit I rented from Comcast.The CM1150V is advertised as having 4 ethernet ports. (This is in the Amazon bullet points: "VERSATILE CONNECTIONS: 4 Gigabit Ethernet ports give you fast wired connections to your computer, separate Wi-Fi router, printer, game box, and other devices." Yes, it has 4 connections. However, 3 of them are disabled. If you need to connect more than one wired device, you must buy a router, too.This was relatively easy to install. I suggest reading the installation instructions carefully rather than assume you know what you are doing.
title: Buyer Beware

author: Paul T. Maack
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 18, 2020
review_content: I got this for Xfinity service, because I hate paying them to rent their device. After 10 months, this thing will have paid for itself.I have a pi hole (DNS level ad-blocking), so it's nice to have a device where you can point to a DNS server of your choosing. Solid device, with no real issues.Pros:- Pays for itself after less than a year.- Prevents you from being controlled by Xfinity.- Allows you to not have other folks connecting to your device if you don't want them to.- Fast enough for basic packages.- Stable/reliable.- Allows for custom network settings (including, but not limited to DNS).Cons:- Uh.... I can't think of any right now. It's literally done everything I've needed it to do so far. If I REALLY have to pick something... I'd say that it gets a bit warm for my taste. They could definitely have designed it with better air flow in mind. Not that it really matters, because even when it's hot it still works better than the modem Xfinity provided.Other thoughts:- Don't let them bully you into paying for their equipment rental, or scare you into thinking this device is somehow going to wreck your life. It's literally their job to try to get you to pay more money.
title: Good to use for Xfinity, especially if you want to control your DNS.

author: Cody
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2019
review_content: First off, this modem has been great. I've been able to get more than the advertised 1Gbps download speed my ISP promised. However, not long after installing it I ran into some issues with what I determined was a MAC address problem with my router. However, I only found this out after spending three hours on the phone with Netgear and THEN finding the answer myself on the Netgear forums. So that's the dichotomy with Netgear. Solid products, terrible support. You better hope that if something does go wrong with your device that it goes wrong in the first 90 days after purchase. That's the only time Netgear will help you over the phone for free. Otherwise, they ask you to pay to continue to receive help. PLEASE DO NOT PAY FOR THIS. There are so many helpful people on the forums who will solve your problem for free. I've seriously had better tech support from comcast. So buyer beware.
title: Great modem for ultra high speed internet connection, terrible tech support

author: Paul R.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2020
review_content: It has four (4) Gb Ethernet ports on the back, but unless you pay for multiple IP addresses with your provider, you'll likely only use 1 or 2.  That's neither a good nor a bad thing, as long as you understand that the modem is NOT a router.  I pay for 600 Mbps, and have achieved 700 Mbps+.  It was set up and working in less than 30 minutes with Comcast/Xfinity.  Signal levels and SNR were nearly identical to the Motorola/Arris modem it replaced (DOCSIS 3.0).  It supports DOCSIS 3.1, could easily handle download speeds of 1 Gbps, and higher using more than one port.  Very low and consistent latency.  I'm not a gamer but for cable this is probably going to be a good performer.I don't know why the Amazon review system asks for a WiFi signal rating.  This is just a modem, it does not have WiFi.  If you don't understand much of this review, you'll save yourself a bit of grief if you just plug your computer or WiFi router into the top Ethernet jack and pretend the others don't exist, lol.  I wish someone would have told me that.
title: This is a very fast cable modem.

author: Sid P.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2020
review_content: I bought this product ($275) as i don't want to pay $14 rental fee to Comcast . After 3 weeks of using the modem, my internet speed is reducing dramatically and seeing the internet connection getting dropped multiple times a day and only way i can fix is by restarting (doing the power cycle reset).  At first, i thought it is a problem with Comcast/Xfinity and called them and spent 2 hours with their tech support and after doing all the tests, they confirmed the issue is not on their end rather the problem is with the netgear cable modem .So I called Netgear Support, after spending 45 mins i got to the right person who can troubleshoot the modem and after another 60 mins of doing multiple checks, she determined the modem has HW issues and need to be replaced. Since i bought 5 weeks ago, she said i can get a replacement for the HW. She sent me an email with the URL to complete the RMA process where the are asking to CC information to charge $30 for shipping. (even though the technician determined it is their Product issue, i still have to pay the shipping charges) and the agent tells me it is their policy.I am so fed up after all this episode, I have to return the product to Amazon with re-stocking fee and ended up getting Comcast rental Modem.Even though it an expensive modem, the tech support Netgear provides is pathetic!!!
title: Netgear charges shipping to replace their damaged product even within the 90 day warranty period!

author: This Is My Name
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2020
review_content: Your browser does not support HTML5 video.           The site interface has about nothing on it with very basic info and it loads slowly. However, after I hooked it up to my router for that gb speed I noticed my cat got faster, my Amazon deliveries got faster, the old lady across the street got faster, my drive to work got faster, and even time started going by faster. Great way to future proof any internet plan you could get as I can't imagine having to ever buy another modem again in my entire life after this. I also don't know why I can rate wifi signal when this has no wifi to begin with 🤔 TIP: if you buy it and can't figure out why your router has no internet then turn them both off and turn them on in order. Turn the modem on first, wait for all the lights to come on, then turn the router on. Of course after calling your ISP and registering it :)Update Dec 2020: why did the price go from 250 to 370 🥶 I got it at a good time.
title: Everything around me started going faster

author: slomobile
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2019
review_content: "Rate features" asks about WiFi signal, it shouldn't.  This modem does not produce a WiFi signal and that is exactly why I chose it.Xfinity WiFi gateways broadcast signals for Xfinity Home and Xfinity Hot spots even if you do not subscribe to those services or explicitly turn them off.  They hide the SSID broadcast, but they still put signals, polluting the crowded local spectrum needlessly.  They also bridge LAN and WLAN and provide no means to separate them.  This product sidesteps those problems by eliminating WiFi radio all together.This Modem is the only DOCSIS 3.1 Xfinity approved modem with  voice as of August 2019.  So if thats what you need, this is your product.Installation required no contact with humans.
title: NOT WiFi

author: Aaron Turner
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 10, 2019
review_content: So if you have Comcast 1Gbps service and have their voice service, then apparently this is the modem for you.  I'm giving 4 stars because it does everything it should and the install was about as easy as possible considering you have to deal with Comcast (pro-tip: their Twitter support is much better then calling their call center).That said, I can't really give 5 stars because for the price (this is not a cheap modem) it doesn't have a battery backup for voice.  Lucky for me, I already have a UPS battery backup that I could use for it, but my old Arris modem which I paid $80 for had a battery backup.I also don't like that the design doesn't allow mounting on a wall and you're stuck with it "sitting up" on the built in stand.  Again, my old Arris modem I was able to mount on the wall in my closet so it was out of the way, but this one sits on the floor which is annoying.But the modem & service is fast and reliable.
title: Only option for Comcast 1Gbps service w/ Voice

author: Ian
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2019
review_content: Started to get internet disconnections about a week ago at random times. It would go offline all night and randomly connect in the middle of the day and work fine for a few hours. Called the cable company and they could not detect the modem. The LED lights would all turn off except for the Ethernet LED. Then hours later they would turn on randomly to try to connect and indicate its connected but really wasn't. This happened to me before on my previous Motorola Surfboard that lasted 5 years, which are the symptoms that the modem is dying. Didn't expect this to happen just a little over a year on a $170 modem. Will not buy Netgear modems again.
title: Lasted a year and 3 months

author: bobbyg53
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2020
review_content: The Netgear CM1000 v2 proved to be an easy cable modem to install and then provision with Suddenlink. They successfully added the MAC address to their system, and within 60 seconds both the downstream and upstream multi-bonded channel indicator lights on the front of the modem were solid green.  The internet connection light became solid green about a minute later.The carton part number was CM1000-1AZNAS, but the actual label on the cable modem states it is a CM1000 v2.  Suddenlink provides a DOCSIS 3.0 cable network at this time, so the CM1000 v2 bonded successfully with 18 downstream and 2 upstream channels.The CM1000 has the fast and highly-respected Broadcom BCM3390 DOCSIS 3.1 SoC chipset.  Ours came with firmware v1.01.03, with access to the Spectrum Analyzer requiring a password-protected login.  We believe that this cable modem with this firmware is secure.As with a previous Netgear cable modem, we have not experienced any cable network disconnects or dropouts.  For us it has been a fast, responsive, and reliable cable modem with built-in security.  Highly recommended.
title: Perfect Suddenlink compatibility, CM1000-1AZNAS carton = CM1000 v2 modem

author: D. P.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2020
review_content: I have been trying to make this work but it turns out the website is full of crap.DOCSIS® 3.0 16x4High Speed Cable ModemZooming Fast High-Speed Cable Internet AccessWith speeds up to 680Mbps and 16x faster than 2.0 devices, this High-Speed Cable Modem gives you speed to spare whether you are streaming or gaming. Plus there are no monthly rental fees. CableLabs DOCSIS 3.0 certified to work with Cable Internet Provides like Comcast XFINITY® from Comcast, Spectrum, Cox, Cablevision & more.I bought this and can't get even get 200MBPS steadily. I would return it if I could, I just had enough time at home to install my new modem and router I bought and they don't work. I am tired of netgear and all the problems.I have purchased.cm200nighthark 7000cm 500nighthawk 7200trying desperately to achiev 600MBPS but only get 200.... ripped off again.. Thanks
title: doesn't reach the speeds intended

author: Mark A. Holton
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 25, 2020
review_content: I would steer clear of NetGear modems.  They are easy to set up and commonplace, which is fine, but they malfunction over time.  This is the 2nd one I have had, this time it stopped working after 19 months.  All lights amber, and couldn't even factory reset.  Presumably when it was unplugged before turning off, but maybe something else.  And prepare to get ZERO support from NetGear.  Buying one of these modems is signing up for hassle 1-2 years from date of first use.  Their support asks you to pay before talking to them about a repair.  Your only recourse is to buy another $170 modem.  For something that is supposed to be top of the line, DOCSIS 3.1 1Gbps, it falls way short.  Will be switching to Motorola MB8600 (who helped develop the DOCSIS standard).
title: malfunction after 19 months

author: ms909698
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2019
review_content: Had this up and running for 2 days now, and I am super happy with the performance! have this running with xfinity gig service. When hard wired I get almost 800 megs down and 50 megs up.Really the download speed is a bit meaningless to me over 100, but comcast has gotten so stingy with their up speeds, that our performance has been getting bad, especially when working from home on zoom calls.  No issue at all since the upgrade.However, by packing the performance in, they left out some features (in the CM1150V version) that may be important for day to day customers. Most importantly, it does not provide routing or wifi. You will need to buy an additional wifi router to attach separately. NETGEAR Nighthawk line should do nicely for a simple setup.Personally, I use (x3) Ubiquiti Unifi Ap-AC Lite access points with one Ubiquiti EdgeRouter X. It requires more advanced setup, but performs nicely...Have not tried adding phone yet, but plan to add that soon.
title: Awesome speed and performance with xfinity gig service

author: Chris R.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2020
review_content: The modem works great.  Instillation is not smooth as you need to call Xfinity to register the device to your account.  The documentation makes you think this is automatic, but not even close.  By far the worst part of the product is it contains a HUGE AC/DC converter at the plug which makes it impossible to plug into any normal UPS system.  The huge plug also is directed sideways vs up/down, so it ends up blocking other outlets on your UPS.  A CyberPower 1500 definitely is not setup for this modem's plug as you'll lose 2 other battery backup plugs (out of 6) if you plug this in, so it effectively takes up 3 of the 6 battery backed plugs!  The previous Arris modem I had used a normal plug and had no issues (took only 1 battery backed up plug).  I'm now looking at having to purchase a UPS simply to keep the modem up and running.  The Arris also had a built-in battery backup for the phone, but this one needs a UPS to support battery backup of the phone feature.
title: Great modem, terrible power connector

author: Craig L. Marquis
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 4, 2020
review_content: At first I was thrilled but after a month the modem was losing signal strength periodically and knocking me off important meetings. I liked the initial speed boost and bought this to maximize my internet speed but it did not last. When I got on with tech support we reset the modem and it appeared to be okay. That did not last. The next hour the modem was not working properly again. Tech support had already closed the ticket and I had to go through the reset process again with the same non results. When I contacted tech support the third time and they wanted me to go through all the same steps I had enough. It did not matter that I already done the reset on my own (by now I was an expert in following the script) and explained that but that did not appear to matter. I explained that I had been doing the same thing for nearly 7 hours and that my time was more valuable to me that the cost of the modem. I made arrangements to send the modem back and replaced it with a Motorola like my old one which has worked perfect since I installed it. May just have been a lemon but I will not by another modem from this company.
title: Not a good modem, may have been defective from the start

author: James
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2020
review_content: We were having huge issues with our wifi before purchasing this modem. We would constantly disconnect. In the middle of a call, we would cut in and out, or just out completely. We'd often have to reset it or just sit and wait until the stupid thing would connect again. We had issues where it would cut out for hours and hours and the only solution was to unplug everything and move it to a completely different room. If you accidentally lost power or unplugged it, you would have to move it to another room. So, we bought a brand new modem--this one--with little hope, but we haven't had a SINGLE problem since we got it! It's going great. The old one was probably just broken from a series of power losses, so now we have the new on attached to a power surge protector.
title: Great modem, works excellent

author: M. Darcy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2020
review_content: It works, provides internet signal output on Ethernet port with coax cable input.  I’m getting the speeds my plan is for.  It worked right away when installing but soon stopped - turns out the problem was that I was trying to make use of the 4 Ethernet ports, using it as a network switch to send to other devices with the wiring in my home.  After a long call to XFinity, they sent me to Netgear who eventually figured it out.  Only one of the outputs will work at a time, or to be more technically correct it will only provide one IP address.  The tech on the phone said a future firmware upgrade will provide capability to use all the ports.  For now the setup will have to be the one port into a router.
title: Works but only one of the included 4 Ethernet ports is active

author: Brian
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2019
review_content: This is the first time that I have broken away from Comcast and bought my own modem instead of renting their combo.  I got this and paired it with the Orbi.  The two work incredibly well together.  This modem also works far better than the one I was renting from Comcast.  Most noticeably, with the rental, I would routinely have the unplug the modem to get it to reboot.  I noticed with this that when the internet freezes after a minute or so it reboots itself or corrects the connection issue on its own.  That is absolutely vital for me.  With everything in the house moving over to being 'smart home' devices, internet stability is HUGE.  If I am not home to reset the modem when it goes down then I lose connection to my security cameras, thermostat, sprinklers, etc. So this modem has been a bit of a relief in that regard and has been able to handle all the traffic in data as well.
title: Great choice for a docsis 3.1 modem

author: TNTRMSKD
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2020
review_content: Just got an Optimum gigabit speed plan so my old docsis 3.0 wasn't going to cut it. They tell you that current modems aren't compatible with their gig plan but that's just to get you to rent their garbage box at $10 a month. After the installer left I immediately unhooked their provided modem and wired up the CM1000. You'll get a prompt for self setup when you open any browser. Follow the directions and you should be up and running in 5-10 mins. Going to drop off their Altice box or whatever they call it tomorrow. This modem will pay for itself in a year or so from the rental fee savings.NEVER LET AN ISP BULLY YOU INTO A MODEM RENTAL FEE!
title: Quick and easy setup!

author: Ranger Doc
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2019
review_content: Got this to replace the Arris branded modem supplied by Spectrum. That modem worked but I was not getting the speeds I was paying for. All the troubleshooting I could do would not resolve the issue, so I decided to just replace the modem with a quality product and landed on this Netgear CM1000.Installation was simple, just swap old for new. Called the Spectrum number and gave them the MAC address for the new modem and was up and running in less than 10 minutes.  Holy smokes! What a difference this made. After swapping, the Netgear CM1000 worked perfectly, actually better than perfect. Speed tests indicates I'm now getting about 50 mbps more than what I pay for!If you have Spectrum internet service, you can't go wrong with this modem.
title: Fixes what Spectrum can't/won't

author: H. Harvey
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 3, 2020
review_content: If you're like me and are deeply attached to VOIP/land-line use and also have an XFinity or Comcast Double/Triple-Play package, you've come here to figure out - what are my options for replacement modems and do I really need one?  And hopefully you know - there are only two replacement voice-enabled options as of July 2020.  So, the core question is - does the CM1150V successfully replace my voice-enabled Comcast/Xfinity Cable modem?  The answer to that is an emphatic YES.  Next, does the CM1150V improve upon the Comcast/Xfinity Cable modem for download speeds if I have Gigabit-level Xfinity service?  The answer to that is also an emphatic YES - for me, moving from a max speed with the Xfinity modem of roughly 670 Mbps to 888.5 Mpbs with the CM1150V - which is a massive improvement!  The last question - is this Netgear modem easy to install?  The answer to that, for me, was NO - but it was still worth it.  The suggested technique of simply connecting to the "activate" link via an ethernet connection to my computer did not work.  I had to call XFinity.  I called late at night (big mistake, as their activation team only works during the day).  As a result, the activation did not work, after a lengthy attempt.  But, by morning, after their activation team kicked in, the Netgear modem was almost successfully provisioned.  I *still* had to perform the "activate" feature, but this time the activate page actually loaded.  Once done, it was off to the speed races!  Bottom line - do *not* attempt to install this at a moment when you critically need internet services, but once you are successful, you won't regret your choice!  Sincerely, a satisfied new Netgear modem convert.
title: Replacing your Comcast/Xfinity Voice-Enabled Cable-Modem - Netgear Does the Trick!

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 23, 2020
review_content: I had a DOCSIS 3.0 modem and my speeds were maxing out at 40Mps even after eliminating other interference. I replaced the modem with this unit. I was able to complete the installation without speaking to anyone at Comcast (worth the price alone!). Using the same client hardware and the same cable plan, my speeds increased to 90Mps with this.
title: Doubled my network speed

author: K Res
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2020
review_content: I purchased this cable modem in August 2020 to replace the modem leased monthly through Comcast.  The Comcast modem worked flawlessly.  However, the Netgear Cable modem CM1150V immediately had connectivity issues where it would drop the internet connection for now apparent reason, requiring a manual reboot of the modem each time.  This connectivity failure occurred 3-5 times per week.  At first, I had though that there was a problem with the Comcast service, and we had multiple visits from the Xfinity technicians.  The problem was isolated to the modem, and was completely corrected with replacing the CM1150V with the Xfinity X1 cable modem.  Despite multiple attempts to speak with NETGEAR service,  I had absolutely no luck getting technical support on the phone.  In fact, since it took some time for us to determine that it was the modem and not the Comcast Xfinity internet service, NETGEAR was asking for me to pay for extended technical support, despite the hardware being under warranty for 1-year from the time of service.  Bottom line.....  This is an expensive purchase that is NOT worth the headaches.  NETGEAR warranty is also misleading in their 1-year support for hardware, but will not help diagnose a problem with the hardware after the initial technical support (90 days) expires.
title: Repeatedly drops internet requiring manual reboot

author: ChiTim
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 18, 2018
review_content: This is only a setup and early use review. Setup (Comcast Xfinity Chicago) went fine, but 30 minutes, not 10 as many people have said. You have to wait for the Internet light to stop flashing. That took about ten minutes as advertised. I did have to go to Comcast.com/activate to complete activation. Logged in with my ID, waited for them to pull down what info they needed (model, firmware, MAC address) and then they reset it and said wait 15-30 minutes. In about 10, the modem was operable and I had a live connection.  I compared three different Speedtest.net local server tests to results I did on the old Xfinity modem and I got 30-35 Mbps down more than before. Not huge but I'll take it along with not having to pay a modem rental fee. Please note that this model IS one that a vulnerability was discovered for a few months ago. So DO change the administrative pass word right away. Download the manual from Netgear to learn how to do that.
title: Improved speed about 25%

author: Matt
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2020
review_content: I've been using this for months now as a replacement to my old modem.  I'm glad I'm not paying Comcast anymore to rent their modem/router combo every month.Setup was a breeze and I paired this with a nice Nighthawk wireless router to give my whole home good speeds.  We currently have a ~100mbit connection and this has been performing fine.
title: Worked right out of the box!

author: Skwint
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2020
review_content: I was not able to make this work on our Suddenlink account in the Lake Tahoe area of California. We were able to get a signal to the modem itself, but it would not push that signal out to the 8 port switch or the eero mesh router system using ethernet. And since this device is only a modem—needing a separate router for Wi-Fi—that was the end of that.  I spent about 2 hours on the phone with Suddenlink support, and wound up reprovisioning the existing rented Arris modem that I was looking to replace. (Spoiler Alert: So I returned this Netgear device, bought a new Arris docsis 3.1. Happy now.)I don’t know know if the problem with this was at the modem end or the ISP end. The modem is on the list of approved devices for Suddenlink so it shouldn’t have been a hardware compatibility issue. It was a factory certified/reconditioned unit, so that may have had something  to do with it. Don’t know.
title: Could not get a a Wi-Fi signal on a Suddenlink cable connection when combined with an eero mesh.

author: Leigh Brown
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2020
review_content: This modem worked ok for several months then died slowly, losing latency then intermittently going off. It was a nightmare to diagnose with us thinking it was a Comcast problem then finding many others have had issues with the Intel Puma modems, it’s on do not buy lists and there are class action suits against Intel for these. Why is it still sold? Replaced with a pre-Puma SB6183.
title: Died slowly and painfully over 6 months

author: Ben
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2019
review_content: I have had internet issues for the past 3 months. Connection being lost randomly or slow and a modem reset sometimes did the trick, sometimes I needed to reset the router too. It got progressively worse a few months ago with disconnects and I had to call my ISP to reset the modem which worked better for some reason. I have had very bad connection issues for the past 6 weeks, and finally narrowed it down to the modem after dealing with my ISP on the phone for hours and replacing my router. My warranty expired 3 weeks ago and after waiting for an hour to talk to Netgear CS, they repeatedly refused to help at all and said they would have to charge me to talk to them. They also revealed that the modem was outside the shelf life of the manufacture date, and SHOULD NOT HAVE BEEN SOLD. They still refused to help at all and said it wasn't their department. Amazed after thinking they were a reliable company.
title: Slowly died in just under a year, CS refused to replace, unit was too old to sell

author: Bruce
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2018
review_content: I dropped my Comcast internet service for two months. I was never happy with the performance from Comcast. I use an Apple Air Port for my router. I was wondering why I’m paying $11/month for a modem/router from Comcast when I was never using the router part. So I returned their equipment and decided to buy this modem only. Comcast does not sell or rent modems. Comcast said on phone, “You have to buy the exact same device they are renting for $200 or more.” They were lying, as usual. I bought this modem over the slightly less expensive one, figuring it might stay up to date longer. I plugged modem in and connected my Airport router via eithernet and checked my phone after a few minutes and I had a Comcast screen to reconnect. Called Comcast, paid my bill and they said I was all set, just wait a few minutes. That didn’t work and I tried again. That still didn’t work, because they are idiots. So I waited for the night shift to come on. In the past, it was always the night shift that would fix the problem. When I tried then I got a guy named Ed. He had me running in just a few minutes! He had to register my device, something the day shift doesn’t know apparently. The modem works great and my speeds have never been faster! And I’m saving $11/month. Other than dealing with the day shift lying idiot bastards, this was practically plug and play! So easy. If it stops working I’ll do an update. So if you don’t see an update you know I am still running and very happy with my purchase.
title: Very easy to set up. Great results. Comcast lies!

author: JaredB
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2020
review_content: First let me start off by saying that I have a Master's Degree in Computer Engineering and so I am far from a novice.The problem with buying this item refurbished is that the failure mode is often an intermittent problem and so their refurbishing process does not test the unit long enough to catch the issue.  Mine drops the internet connection every 24-48 hours requiring me to unplug the unit, wait 30 seconds, and then power it back on.When you contact Netgear and they force you to work with their (foreign) tech support they will conclude that the problem is either your internet provider (mine is Xfinity) or your router (I tried two routers one that I know works from another setup that I have and a brand new Google Nest Mesh Router).  Then, even though you bought a refurbished modem, Netgear will tell you that they will not replace it because they cannot find a problem with the unit.This is a shameful practice on the part of Netgear and I will never buy their overpriced and under-supported products again.
title: Buyer Beware!!!

author: LV_Tom
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2019
review_content: I upgraded my Cable internet to gigabit and needed a gigabit Docsis 3.1 modem and this one fit the bill at a reasonable price.. Simply transferred the cables from the other modem over, registered it with the company and started it up.. it has no problems delivering the speed.. I did end up buying a cat-7 cable to go between the modem and router which seemed to help getting more reliable speed tests.. I also had to replace my router because it could not deliver the gigabit.. I got an Tp-link AC-5400 and everything is fast!  Modem has no real setup required and worked out of the box.
title: This modem delivers the speed.

author: Nick
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2019
review_content: I bought this specifically because the product page says "4 Gigabit Ethernet ports give you fast wired connections to your computer, separate Wi Fi router, printer, game box, and other devices". I wanted a cable modem + NAT router but should have been more careful. This has no router capabilities. It does allow you to bridge ethernet ports 1 & 2, and/or use separate IP addresses for ports 1-4. It does not do any routing. If you plug this in your cable company will see another device attached and refuse to give it access unless you've paid and set it up.Other than that it seems faster than the Panoramic WiFi that Cox gave me. I'll keep it since I may need the 3.1 speeds later, but the whole point was for this $170 to end up cheaper than renting the cable company's router, but now I need a NAT router as well.
title: Misleading - No router capabilities

author: B
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2020
review_content: I'm a tech hobbyist but this was my first time setting up a modem and NETGEAR router for my home; I was extremely impressed with how easy the setup was! There's a quick start guide with about 8 steps that shows you how to set up the modem and then the router if you would like WiFi. I paired this modem with a NETGEAR 4-Stream WiFi 6 Router (RAX15) and the signal strength is a lot stronger and loads Netflix faster than the equipment my cable company gave me (their modem was made by Arris and their router was D-Link, I feel these were mediocre boxes). My internet plan allows for 100mbps download and 35mbps upload; I receive that basically wherever I am in my condo now! The modem does say 500mbps max download for wired via ethernet; I have my desktop wired and it claims the speed is 1.0gbps (which is 1000mpbs) not sure why it is doubled but I'm not complaining! The only thing is this modem does not have a port for the telephone line; though this does not impact me because I do not have a landline. For anyone that does though, just be cautious of this device! Otherwise, I think this is a fantastic modem and I would recommend it to anyone looking to upgrade their home internet; stop paying your internet provider to rent their cheap equipment and just pick this up instead!
title: Smaller size and faster speeds than the cable company's modem I was spending $120/year to rent!

author: ShadowMario3
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2020
review_content: I recently upgraded to gigabit internet with Comcast, but my current modem/router combo wasn't able to deliver those speeds, so I upgraded to this. It is very easy to set up. As always, write down the two MAC numbers along with the serial number. However, to make sure that Comcast provisions the modem for both the Internet and Phone, I always call their customer service to make sure they activate the modem for both services, as activating it through the browser doesn't always work out.After doing that (took around half an hour to make sure they properly provisioned both services and completely removed my old modem), I connected my Nighthawk router to Port 1 and main telephone to Line 1, the Internet went to a full gigabit (for download) speed (when connected to the router directly through Ethernet), and the phone was working as expected.Ports 2, 3, and 4 are not used for other devices since, according to the manual found on the Netgear website, "These ports can be used to connect a router that supports Ethernet port aggregation.". Also, they arrive with plugs that cover them already, so the Amazon description is misleading about these ports.So far, no issues for the last 24 hours, and hopefully it'll stay that way.
title: Compatible with Gigabit speed

author: Bob S
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2020
review_content: I purchased this to replace a modem that was fried by a lightning strike, after first making sure that my cable was grounded to prevent future mishaps. It worked great for over 11 months, then my connection started dropping. I thought it was the router at first, so tried using an older model, but the drops kept happening and more frequently. So I put the newer router back on and tried an old backup modem, suddenly the connection issues were fixed.Having determined that the modem was the problem and that there were still two weeks left on the one year warranty, I tried filing a claim to get the modem replaced on Netgear's site. No one touched the claim for over a week, so I emailed them asking for a status update, whereupon I was informed that I needed to call their tech support number. The tech support person I connected with then explained to me that he was only allowed to help me during the first 90 days, and if I wanted him to diagnose my problem I needed to buy an extended warranty that cost more than the modem had. I asked what the point of the modem having a one year warranty was, if they were unable/unwilling to do anything to fix the situation  and just got more spiel about how buying the extended warranty would also cover any other networking equipment I owned. After being frustrated for 20 minutes I hung up.So buyer beware, while Netgear advertises a one year warranty, it's simply not true. You get 90 days and after that you're either on your own or you buy one of their expensive extended warrantys. Personally, I'm going to give other brands a try and avoid Netgear.
title: Worked great until it didn't

author: Sean
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2020
review_content: Purchased this Modem in May 2020 due to the reviews.  Worked fine for two months then it started having issues with dropping speed.  Phone calls sounded like you were talking through a fan.  Xfinity made multiple visits to my (a total of 5), tested the modem and lines.  They replaced the heads on each line.  Modem worked fine for a the internet for a day or two then speed dropped out and had to do multiple reboots to get any speed.  Phone quality would improve for a day and then go back to the static.  Xfinity provided a loaner.  This modem and phone quality worked perfectly.Netgear said they had to do a diagnostic check of the modem so I had to call Xfinity to deactive my loaner modem and reactive my Netgear modem.Before this was done I explained to the tech that the modem was not activated and they said that just need to me to plug it in.  The first two lights lit up and they said this showed the modem was working correctly and it would have to be an internal problem.So I re-actived the Netgear modem and they indicated that it since it was an internal problem with the modem (even though the phone service was not working) I would to subscribe to their phone service for an "highly trained" technician to reconfigure this modem to "optimize" it since the 90 day period was over.This modem has a 1 year "hardware" warranty on it which is as is good until May 2021.So I have pay them to reconfigure my modem for it's internal hardware issues. Th warranty is an good as the paper it's written on which worthless!I now have a $247 brick for my desk.  Won't be purchasing any Net gear products in the future
title: Not dependable

author: S. Guthrie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2020
review_content: The Amazon site FALSELY  claims it works with ALL internet providers.My story:My old modem and router combination was not working well (with TDS Service) (Fall 2020).The old ones had worked fine the previous 2-3 hears.The TDS tech recommended getting a Netgear Router (N600) and Netgear Modem (Sept,2020).I received the router on Sept 11, and the Modem on Sept. 12.I set them up and started using them on Sept. 13.The results were terrible.  The connections continuously turned off.  Sometime I could restart, and sometimes I would give up--and then after a bit, I would have a connection.On 9/21, a TDS technician came, checked, and could find nothing wrong.  But the problems persisted.  Although I could get a connection intermittently, I often could not use my email, and it would stop working in the middle of a project.-- Sometimes able to reconnect, and sometimes not.Two or three times, I called TDS, and they would fix something, and it would work OK for a couple days.On 10/13, a new TDS technician came.  He said that NETGEAR modems would not work correctly with TDS.He gave me (trial basis) a new modem/router combination.  The on and off problem persisted.On 10/14, this second technician came back, found there was something wrong with the modem and replaced it with a different modem/router combo unit (ARRIS).  He told me to send back the NETGEAR modem, get a modem from another company (ARRIS, and one other, but NOT Netgear , but I could retain the Netgear router.The TDS Modem/router (ARRIS) has been mostly working (95%).  And the speed is much faster than it had been--25% faster and about 100-110% of what I am paying for.Today, 10/16, I game to Amazon to attempt to return the NetGear modem.  It tells me I should have returned it within a month of when I bought it,  and I am a few days too late to return it.I haven't contacted Netgear yet, and that is my next step.It's very annoying that I have wasted a month trying to get the Netgear equipment to work, and now I find out its too late to return it to Amazon.
title: Does NOT WORK with TDS Internet Service.

author: emil
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2020
review_content: Initially bought a CM700 and it worked for a few months. Then my internet intermittently went out or was very slow and never attained half the speed I was paying for. After blaming optimum for some time and getting nowhere I did a lot of research to figure out what was happening. Turns out that the CM700 among many other modems have a defective chip. (Check badmodems.com for more on that) I decided to replace it just in case with this CM1000 and it has worked for months with no issue. No outages and I'm hitting speeds I didn't before. If you're having issues, check that site against your modem and see if it's your modem that needs replacement
title: Great modem

author: Alex Z.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2020
review_content: I have not been able to get over 100mbps with this modem not LAN or WiFi. I was getting over 500mbps with my comcast modem/router combo. I just did not want to pay the fee's anymore. Comcast went out of their way to try to help me with my Netgear equipment. I have spent hours with them on the phone, they came to my house and ran all new wires and upgraded my system for no extra charge.. but NetGear will not help me. They have ended a few chats with me because they cannot help me... but the worst part is, they do not even give me advice. They ask what I have done, then tell me that is all the steps they would go over and they will update my case. No one reaches out to me to follow up, I just wait a few days and connect again... to get the same response. I am not even asking for a replacement. I just want to know what to do to fix my issue. I have hard reset the modem. I have used every software update possible and brought it back a few updates and no change. It makes me want to pull my hair out.
title: Slow Speeds and Bad Tech Support

author: Mia Zhu
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2020
review_content: On receiving the equipment, followed the setup instructions on the pack. It took estimated 10-15 minutes to set this up. Please note that they recommend plugin an Ethernet for setup, and everything I set was on my mac.After the setup, my WIFI speeds seems to be more stable and much much faster. Hitting 100 MBPS over air.Pros:- Pays for itself after less than a year.- Prevents you from being controlled by Xfinity.- Allows you to not have other folks connecting to your device if you don't want them to.- Fast enough for basic packages.- Stable/reliable.- Allows for custom network settings (including, but not limited to DNS).Cons:- Uh.... I can't think of any right now. It's literally done everything I've needed it to do so far.
title: Fast & Works

author: Santos Carvajal-Gonzalez
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2020
review_content: When I ordered and received the product, I was eager to check a box on my "to be tested" list of manufacturer. After 3 days of using it, I was disappointed to put this product in "never again".During installation and activation of my new 1Gbps/voice package, CM1150V was slow to connect and to reboot. That was the first sign of "trouble is coming". After 2 hours of use, the signal was coming in and out  at the internet and voice level with no DHCP address provided by ISP . The signal was not stable at all. I called my provider three times in the next 4 days, spending 10 hours on the phone (and  I am not talking about the number of soft and hard resets), a technician came and rewired from the pole to my house with RG6 cable (speed up to 1 Gbps). Switch on the modem, nothing happen. Replace modem by a lease modem, it works. Either the modem is faulty or the signal is to low to be detected (error in conception) or else.... I decided to return the product waiting for more manufacturer to produce DOCSIS 3.1 modems or having anew version of this product which is really functioning 99.9% of the time.
title: I should have read previous feedback before ordering

author: Joseph Cintron
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2020
review_content: Installation was fairly easy, while there is online activation it doesn’t seem to work for spectrum. After a failed attempt I called the number on the quick start guide (*note* I called the number on the site but it was an automated system that failed to activate it so make sure to call the number on the guide to avoid a small headache) and without any confusion had it activated and working in 15 minutes. Now as for speeds I had it connected to my computer for immediate testing, I performed three tests in three different sites; fast.com, speedtest ookla, and google speedtest. On average I received a result of 470 Mbps, I pay spectrum for 400Mpbs. Sadly that was the last of the good news. After the testing I promptly moved the modem downstairs to its rightful place aside the router, and the signal drops began. After booting it for the first time with my router connected everything seemed fine until about 13 minutes later I noticed my connection was gone on my computer, I walked over to the modem and saw that it had lost connection to the isp. After this I kept my eye on the clock and almost every 13 minutes it would drop the signal and 2 minutes later it would come back. It did this about ten times in a row. Luckily after this I decided to ignore the drops and hope that it was just temporary, after that it dropped signal after 30 ish minutes and later would stay online for another hour and a half. I haven’t noticed any more drops since that night.Moral of this story is; it’s a good modem but do keep in mind the one and two star reviews as they probably are a possible outcome you could get after buying this modem. I bought it used as the price difference was over 100 dollars and honestly expected it to be dead on arrival, so if you have the chance buy used since you can just return or replace if it doesn’t work
title: Good but be aware of it’s bad reviews.(kinda long review)

author: James Zawacki
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 8, 2020
review_content: So, because this listing has 8 different models attached to it, I'm reviewing the CM1200 model.  Purchased because I subscribe to 1Gbps internet and I'll be honest, it's hard to get anything near 1Gbps throughput.  I can't blame this modem, I believe Comcast is overselling bandwidth and can't deliver on it.  But, on average, an internet speed test through this modem will do 850Mpbs without issues if I am directly plugged into the modem.Of course, with a modem, you need to make sure the router/firewall you install is capable of supporting your internet speed if you are up in the 1Gbps speeds.Last note, people complaining about a modem not having WiFi is just silly and you should disregard their reviews, as they aren't technical enough to be reviewing a MODEM (MOdulator / DE-Modulator, it's SOLE job is to convert one medium to another and nothing else).
title: Works great for me!

author: CW
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2020
review_content: the highest speed from CM1000 I received was only up to 600Mbps , average is between 500-550Mbps, direct wired between PC and modem based on Cox gigablast speed, due to 3rd party modem, Cox tech basically can't troubleshoot it. After a phone call with netgear tech, he pointed out that download power signal range should be +7~-7 however the power I received was 7-15, resulted in not able to get speed around 900 or more. In this case, nothing netgear tech can do, instead, they asked Cox tech to change boot file of the modem, as of today, the correct version for CM1000 should be V3.01.04 however it didn't work out. The power signal was even higher than V5.01.04. Under this circumstances, it's not easy to get resolved unless Cox tech is willing to check the signal from their cables otherwise no resolutions as long as they say it's 3rd party modem. If you are planning to get this modem, make sure you have giga speed circuit or will get it within 30 days to test if it reaches anywhere around 900 to get what you paid for.
title: issue with Cox gigablast

author: rkruz
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 3, 2020
review_content: The cable modem was easy to install.  I wanted something without wireless or enet ports as I already have my own network.  I use Cox Cable and it connected right away.  Just simple connect to coax, ethernet port and power up.  It goes through a boot up sequence then after many seconds connections to modem and your local router.  However, the status lights are ridiculous to use.  They are tiny and dim.  There is about a 10 degree viewing window that you have to be within to even see them lit up.  The ID lettering is not backlit and you  cannot read them so dim or dark area bring a lamp if you want to read the status lights.
title: Simple Install Plug and Play but Tiniest Hard to Read Status Lights.

author: William M
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2019
review_content: Ordered this cable modem in late September. Set-up was simple and straightforward, and it worked as intended for about five or six weeks. Then is started dropping the Internet connection. At first it was just once or twice a day, but the frequency of drops increased rapidly. I was able to confirm that the modem was at fault because the separate router still connected my local-area computers, and a leased modem-router had no trouble making and keeping a connection. The modem got very hot in use, even though it was several inches away from anything on one side, and open to the room on all other sides, including top and bottom. Maybe I got a faulty device, but this wasn't a good purchase for me.
title: Short life-span

author: C. M. Torgeson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2019
review_content: Likes:Works well, although I had to phone into Xfinity to activate.  I tried to use the web page, but you cannot get the internet connection working using the web activation page.  I cannot fault the cable modem for this of course.Fast: getting 330 Mbps down, 40 Mbps upDoes not have WiFi, which is a relief since turning off the default Xfinity network is often a huge pain in the neck.Dislikes:No wall mount capability.  It's so light and the base so weak that the coaxial cable causes it to topple over.  You cannot really lay it on it's side because the base is too wide.  Bad design.Status lights can only be seen in the dark.  Seriously, you cannot read the status lights unless it's dark.
title: Works well

author: HS
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2020
review_content: We've had this since September 2020.While at the beginning it worked great and was an upgrade from our prior equipment, it seems to be failing already.  Our signal is dropping and lagging--the issues we originally corrected with this purchase.  Everything was fine until about 2 weeks ago.  Nothing has changed--we have not added equipment and one of the people originally working from home on meetings all day is no longer working from home.  It is frustrating to buy something and have it work for only 3 months.Our wifi is fine, we have Google mesh which shows everything in perfect working order throughout the house.Of course, this is failing AFTER the return period has passed.
title: Failing after only 3 months!

author: G. Davis
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2020
review_content: I experienced connectivity issues after installing and activating this unit with xFinity. This addressing this required- Multiple calls to xFinity customer support- Almost 3 hours on calls with Netgear- 4 day wait for a visit from an xFinity technicianThe net result is that Netgear recommended firmware version 6.01.06 for the CM1000v2. xFinity activates with version 7.01.01, which is correct for a different model CM1000 (not v2). Both Netgear and xFinity said this might cause connectivity problems. The xFinity tech couldn't do anything since firmware is deployed by central server and instead recommended replacing the unit with a CM1000 or, better yet, a unit from a different manufacturer. After wasting a week on this, I'm taking that advice.
title: xFinity customers beware - CM1000v2 has firmware compatibility issues

author: Michael C
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2020
review_content: AUG/11/20 Never wrote a review ever, but I had to with this.. I had the product for less than a month before it broke. If you have the following lights flashing/on your device below and is NOT responding to its reset button, it's BROKE.Power light (green blinking fast), upload download and gateway (orange/red blinking fast), Lan (orange solid/on). These lights will be in this way even without a coaxial cable and ethernet cable plugged in. I had to get in contact with netgear and they told me that if the green light in this situation is blinking rather than solid and it's not responding to the reset button it needs to be replaced.The install for xfinity was of a pain. You have to contact them to have your modem be placed on your plan. You just need to provide the Mac address on the bottom of the device. However if you run into issues while the modem is being set up with xfinity on the phone AND the lights are all on with NO internet still make sure to unplug the device and plug it back in. It would've saved me a long time of sitting on the phone for longer than I needed to wait for trouble shooting. Xfinity had no idea why with all the lights on the device green it wasn't connecting so I suggested to unplug it once all lights were on and everything was ok to go once all lights were back on.The process of getting it replaced was a hassle as well. I contacted Amazon for replacement and because Amazon had no idea how the product worked they asked "well did you contact manufacturer?". I told them no however I went through all trouble shoot processes and the reset button doesn't reset the device and that I'm still within replacement period with Amazon. They said "contact manufacturer, if it doesn't work still they will replace it". Netgears customer service was great with helping and in my color code statement was what they said to me. That if the power light is blinking and non responsive, that the device needs to be replaced. They offered a replacement, but said if you're within the return time with Amazon go through them to get it replaced. I then contacted Amazon once again to explain the situation. That I was told to contact back if the manufacturer wasn't able to get it up and running. Then they asked me specifically "what steps did the manufacturer tell you to do in order to troubleshoot the device" I then explained everything that I did and everything I did with netgear. They had to check to see if I was within the return time and Amazon said they will send a replacement.The product has 30 days from purchase from Amazon to replace it, however if you're still within 90 days of purchase netgear will replace it. Amazon has sent me a replacement and I will update my rating once I've used this just as long as the previous one within issues. Hopefully I just had a faulty device and won't have an issue with this one.
title: Broke in less than a month: Take your own risk

author: silvernotes
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2020
review_content: This is a voice/modem for Comcast accounts to replace the piece of unreliable junk Comcast was billing me $15/mo for. Plug it in, be patient, and modem sets itself up, including letting Comcast know. Easy. Seems to be about 15% improvement in internet speed. Voice and phone number transferred over with no problems too.
title: Easy setup

author: Chris Elias
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2020
review_content: This thing is sooooo worth it exceptYou need a laptop with an Ethernet port to set this up!Also be aware that this suddenly may stop working it's 95 percent of the time comcast if you are using them and they will blame the device and try to get you back on the rentalWhat they do is send a boot file to the device and it tells it what speed to work at but since their rentals throttle their own service when these work better it thinks it's working in correctly or you are trying to steal from them so they lock it up and your router won't be allowed to communicate with itOnly single hardwired connection directly to the modem will workComcast is amazing but their customer service is horrible when they don't know technical things like this they won't undo it and you gotta keep escalating the issue up until some one undoes it for you that understands. Or even call a comcast business tech to help you they just seem to know moreAgain this thing is AMAZING!!!!! IM GETTING 890MBPS ON A 600MBPS PACKAGE
title: Cm700

author: Charmby
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2019
review_content: I've been renting a modem from Mediacom for several years. I pay for high speed internet, but I rarely got it with the rented modem. I had to reset the modem all the time, sometimes 5 times a day because we'd lose connectivity. I live in a rural area, so I was never sure what was going wrong- whether it was Medicom or our equipment. Mediacom would come out to my house and each time it's like they replaced the rented modem with an even older version. I'm pretty sure the last one was from 1995. That's what it looked like. So finally, I did the research and figured out which modem is compatible with Mediacom and purchased this one. You do have to buy a separate router- the modem gathers the internet from the Mediacom cable and then the router broadcasts it as wifi. I had to figure that out as well. So you need both this modem and a router unless you just want to use an ethernet cable from the modem to your computer without using wifi. Long story longer, this modem with the router I purchased (NETGEAR R6700 Nighthawk AC1750 Dual Band Smart WiFi Router, Gigabit Ethernet (R6700) ) fixed our internet problems. We now enjoy steady, fast internet with this NetGear modem: download speeds normally 50+ mbps with wifi and 130+ mbps on my son's gaming computer that we plug straight into the modem with an ethernet cable. It was an investment but totally worth it.
title: Helps me actually get the internet speed I pay for

author: Wojo
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2020
review_content: This was the top-performing cable modem when I bought it.  Bringing it online with Comcast/Xfinity and provisioning it with the latest firmware was a simple matter*.  Testing (without Comcast's speed limiting in place) gave us over a gig download and over 60Mbps upload (the maximum Comcast provides in my area).* Cable modems are fairly basic devices with a power supply, cable connection input and RJ45 connection to your router.  So long as you have the DOCSIS 3.0 or 3.1 your cable company supports, there is a good chance your modem will have better performance than the cable company provides.  Be wary if the cable company says your cable modem is bad, replacing the modem is often their first suggestion and is often not necessary.
title: Gig-Speed DOCSIS 3.1 works with Comcast/Xfinity and others

author: Serge
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2020
review_content: I have used this modem with Xfinity for 8 months now on 1Gb plan. Having experience with other modems before it seems solid and does deliver 800Mb where I am.Pros: simple design, multi port support, good speed. Xfinity 1Gb support out of the boxCons:* (minus one star) ethernet ports are flimzy. In hot weather we are in right now modem start to lose ethernet connectivity. Usually solved by disconnecting home ethernet and connecting back or wiggling. Wiggling is a problem, ethernet port should have none especially with provided cable.* (minus two stars): Support is a highway robbery. Device is on the warranty and you just paid $200 for it. In order to diagnose device problem (see above) they are asking to get premium support and pay another 100$+ for a privilege to have warranty (hardware) support.Bottom line: 4 different devices from Netgear later I am now strongly considering to switch to other alternative with first opportunity.
title: Good potential, weak manufacturing, terrible support

author: Ty McMahan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2020
review_content: This is a MODEm only as there is no firewall or wifi integrated. I personally prefer this type as I want to  add my own wifi access points and my own firewall.  This thing worked right out of the box. I plugged in the coax, the LAN canle to a laptop and powered it up. Then I had a 15-minute call where the  Xfinity/comcast tech activated it on their end. That was it! Super easy setup. I even bought the Amazon refurb model to save some money. Worked like a charm. I have ben using for over a week and it is super fast. I have 300Mbps  but this model will do up to 1Gbps. This comes with a short ethernet and power cord I recommend getting a good coax cable. Comcast shipped me one free under the “DIY install” option when I signed up. I will be running this modem with an open source PFsense router/firewall.
title: Excellent! No wifi/firewall = FAST speed. Don’t forget to add your firewall/router!

author: JPN850R
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2019
review_content: This modem is working well at the moment for Xfinity (Comcast).  While ISP's modem is a on-in-all package, you need a router to use wifi at home.  I used to live in an apartment and was paying for Comcast's modem, but had I known this sooner I would have saved quite a bit of money.If you're moving to a new place, this is a good time to switch to your own modem & router combo, as the Xfinity tech would not charge extra to set up the modem & router for you.  Also note, that unless if you are a heavy on-line game player, the slowest speed service more than suffices.  I watch youtube often but has not noticed any performance differences with the slowest service I use now as compared to the mid-grade service I used to use.  Don't let them fool you and save your $$$.
title: Get your own modem+router & save money

author: Placesandspaces
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2019
review_content: So far so good.  I have Comcast Business internet to my home.  The CM1200 is one of the few compatible modems that is compatible with Comcast’s Business internet services.  Activation was smooth.  It has 4 gigabit ports.  I have an Orbi mesh router and a Nighthawk AX 12 router connected to the CM1200 and both are working great.  I believe only under Comcast’s Business subscription(s) are multiple IP’s available but not 100% sure about that.  Paying for 150 mbs down and 20 MB’s up.  I am actually getting close to 180 down and 20 up which is exceeding what I pay for.  As for now I would definitely recommend this router especially for a small business.  Also capable of link aggregation for faster file transfers. A worthwhile investment!
title: CM1200 Definitely Worth A Look

author: Josh Taylor
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2018
review_content: I rarely write reviews, but I couldn't help myself with this one. I'll be as brief as possible.I switched to Xfinity so purchased this modem on a Wednesday, arrived on Friday. Invested the next 5 hours from 1pm to 6pm attempting to set this modem up. Tried for the first 45 minutes to set it up on my own, but couldn't get it (I'm a millennial, meaning, I'm not completely technologically inept and can generally figure tech stuff out on my own). So, I called Xfinity, spent an hour, nothing, told me to call Netgear. Called Netgear, spent an hour, nothing, told me to call Xfinity. Called Xfinity (second time), spent an hour, nothing, told me to call Netgear. Called Netgear (second time), spent an hour, nothing, so I gave them my phone number and they said a "Senior Technician" would call me that night. It should be no surprise that I never received a call from said "Senior Technician". I returned that modem to Amazon the next day and purchased the Motorola MG7540 instead, which was delivered LESS THAN 24 HOURS LATER (yea, it's twice the cost, but I also don't have to bother with a separate router and more cords, so, meh).
