review_content: Had in service for almost a year but still under warranty.  Unit would not connect to internet.  Had cable provider come and verify internet signal was good. Problem with modem. Called Netgear had me run several checks said not a hardware problem needed to up support level by buying service agreement. Decided that was ridiculous so purchased a Motorola modem to see what would happen. It is working beautifully. Very disappointed in Netgear have Orbi for router so was not happy to learn they are Netgear also. So neither Amazon or Netgear would take back a defective product still under warranty.
title: Netgear doesn’t back up product warranty

author: Mike
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2020
review_content: For the first two months it worked flawlessly, I was getting the speeds I was supposed to be getting from my ISP. During third month I started getting random disconnects from the internet that lasted for less then a minute but was enough to interrupt streaming or my connection to my company's vpn. As the month went on, the disconnects started getting longer until the internet just disconnected one day and never came back. I had my ISP come out and test everything and the signal was perfect. The tech was getting 1.2 Gbps on his test equipment but with the modem I couldn't pass 1 Mbps. If I factory reset the modem I will get the speeds I am supposed to for a couple of hours and then it dies out again. I replaced the modem and now I am getting stable speeds again.
title: Do Not Buy

author: D. ROBINSON
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2018
review_content: When my product arrived.. I unboxed.. and then called my ISP.  did the swap out with them on the phone and it went smoothly with no issues.  I have 500Mb connection and this modem delivers that with ease.. I get the same or better speeds in some cases over the rental model I  was paying $10 a month for.  This is connected to my Orbi mesh system.  no issues and has been more stable than the rental model was. With my rental (CM800) I think it was.. I occasionally would  just lose internet connection or port forward settings would be ignored and certain apps would have connectivity issues.  Since I made the swap.. 100% stable, no drops and all settings are stable.  My ISP is WOW (used to be knology).  I have had zero issues so far.
title: No more rental fees!!

author: Brandon Scriber
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2019
review_content: Comcast emailed me and said I could have 500mbps if I upgraded to Docsis 3.1. So I did some research and decided on this Modem. I had the Arris Surfboard SB6190 which worked great for my downloads around 250mbps. Once I received this item I installed it with ease and called Xfinity. They had me downloading at 480 within minutes. Modem runs cool and quite. Very happy with its speed for both download/upload/ping.As you can see over the last 5 months in the picture I have had very consistent results!
title: Big improvement

author: Cruz
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2020
review_content: By far the best modems on the market. I have this modem connected to a knighthawk XR700 via the 10G SFP+ port on the router as wan and the blue multigig light comes on on the modem.  Also using Cat8. Spectrum ISP is stingy on the upload caped at 40 Mbps but the download speeds are good. Still tinkering with setting  but for review purposes. The CM2000 delivers.
title: Multigig works.

author: Terrible JJ
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2019
review_content: Really wanted to love this 2Gb modem for my upgraded Xfinity speed (at 1Gb now but wanted headroom), but, alas, this thing is a buggy mess. I currently have 3 devices plugged into the top 3 ports, as follows:(1) Ethernet to WAN port on my Netgear RX 120 Wifi Router(2) Ethernet to DVR box from Xfinity(3) Ethernet to Xbox One SUnfortunately I get to choose whether I want internet access for my Xbox One or my Wifi router-connected devices. I can't have both! If my wife and I (or our kids) want to stream some Netflix off the Xbox One, reboot the router and get internet access on that device, BUT... all our iphones, ipads, PCs, etc. (i.e. the REST OF THE FREAKING HOUSE) is completely DOA for internet. Wanna connect those devices back to the 'net? Sure thing! Just reboot this modem again and we've got it sorted. What's that? I wanted to have internet for my Xbox at the same time? Silly idiot!Reboot the modem AGAIN and AGAIN and AGAIN every time I want internet access on my connected Xbox or my other devices. I CAN NEVER GET ALL DEVICES ONLINE AT ONCE. Piece of crap.
title: A Buggy Mess - STAY AWAY

author: Bryan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2020
review_content: Leave it to netgear to take the cable out of the cable modem!  I haven’t had cable internet inOver 6 years, been blessed with Fiber, I moved and no fiber at the new place and I don’t like the equipment that is included with providers service, so I bought my own “cable modem”! CABLE but cheap netgear for 169$ Does not include a coax cable but the include the cat6 which most people have  spares of.  This left me stuck at 7 pm at night with no internet and having to scout LA for a coaxJust for this it’s being returned at 169$ Netgear can suck it
title: No Cable with the Cable Modem!!

author: Marcus
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2020
review_content: It was working fine for 7-8 months and like everyone else it started intermittently cutting out my internet. No rhyme or reason.  . I called Netgear (because it says there is a 1 year warranty) but they won't even talk to me unless I pay $89 for a 6 month support contract. Apparently although they advertise a 1 year warranty, all tech support stops at 90 days. DO NOT BUY THIS MODEM!!
title: STAY AWAY!!!!

author: Roman
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2019
review_content: I have Comcast cable internet paired with DirecTV (because ATT internet speeds stink where I am). I bought this to increase the speed of my old modem. Opened it up switched the service over to the unit, hooked it up to my router and this thing has been humming along ever since. I don’t think I’ve ever had to reset it since I purchased it and it pays for itself before the year is over due to the outrageous fees Comcast charges. Don’t lease equipment when it’s this easy to buy it and set it up.
title: Stop leasing equipment and buy this instead. Pays for itself.

author: J. Hunter
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 22, 2020
review_content: Phenomenally Good Cable Modem w/Multi-Gig Capability. Easy to setup, and the performance far exceeded expectations. I purchased the Nighthawk AX12 12 combo (WiFi 6 AP), and "wow" is the word  --takes Home/Small Business WiFi to the next level for ALL purposes, and a ever growing number WIFi devices connecting to the network.  The Multi-Gig capability of the  Nighthawk Cable Modem CM1200/Nighthawk AX12 combo  was an awesome surprise! Absolutely love it!!
title: Phenomenally Good Cable Modem w/Multi-Gig Capability

author: Lue
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 7, 2020
review_content: Tech support is only available for the first 90 days. After that, Netgear wants you to pay for support and won't talk to you otherwise. What a joke!!
title: Stay Away!

author: Temlakos
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2019
review_content: First, this is not a gateway. It is only a modem. You must use a router (available separately) to handle the usual networking functions in your home or office. (Happily, routers aren't nearly as expensive as are gateways.)As a modem, it performs flawlessly. Upload and download speeds are as fast as you can get with a coaxial cable and the proper subscribed service.When you need to handle port forwarding and similar services at gigabit level, you must buy separate modem and router. The combined price is less than half what you would pay for a true gateway at this service level.
title: The one for gigabit service

author: Big T
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2019
review_content: Just got this today.Provisioning with Comcast was cake through the modem.  Even though the directions suggest you should have your Comcast account number, the MAC of the router, serial number and MTA number handy, I didn't need them to get set up.However, I wasn't getting max speed - confirmed 1gig down with old modem before I switched, then could only get ~ 150Mbs down after installation.  So, I plugged the modem directly into my laptop bypassing all other network hardware just to be sure and still only could get 150 Mbs.  Called Netgear - they had little to offer and no resolution and they pointed the finger at Comcast.  Called Comcast and said from their point of view the modem had provisioned appropriately.  More reboots of the modem and no change.  So, I figured what the heck, I'll try amazon's new tech support - they hung up on me twice.  No so helpful.I ordered a replacement and will update this review with my experience with the replacement next week.
title: getting only 150 mbs on 1 gig service

author: Manuel
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2019
review_content: I saw a couple of reviews that this device drops signal. Well it had to happen to me after my 30 days returned-period, now I have to be stuck on the phone with Netgear to claim a new device but they want to do troubleshoot and all the 9 yards. I already had 6 techs in here thinking it was my Internet provider but it resulted it's this defective modem causing all the trouble.Save the headache and get something else!!
title: Stay Away from This Device!

author: TCKim
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2020
review_content: The  modem is great when there are no issues.Once you run into an issue, good luck...First you will most likely need to pay for "support" even if it's hardware related that is within the warranty as they will not provide any support other than ask for colors on the modem to check if there are "hardware" failures.Most will be caught through this but not all.Once you purchase the support, expect to wait at least 3 hours for “paid” technical support.  When you purchase the support, make sure you purchase the cheapest as most likely unless you have other serious issues, you won't run into many issues. As I stated before, when there are no issues, this is a great modem.Unless you want to want 7-10 days without internet, also expect to pay for expedited shipping and make sure you return the defective unit within 15 days, otherwise they will charge you for another modem.
title: great modem ... when there are no issues.

author: Philanon
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2020
review_content: I bought this because I was having signal problems and my cable company was denying it. They lock users out of the modems that they provide for free now, so you can't see the signal strength or event logs. Once I replaced their modem and was able to review the logs, I scheduled a tech visit and showed them to the tech who then identified the issue and fixed it. It's a shame we have to do this as customers, but it is what it is. Please, make sure your cable company supports this modem with the speeds you have available before you buy it - they should have a list on their website.
title: Useful signal and log information

author: Luke @HuzzahGamers
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 2, 2020
review_content: The modem has been solid for the two years I have owned it. This last week my speeds have dropped from 1Gbps to 150Mbps...I contacted Comcast and they said my modem isn't responding to all channels and that I need to contact the Manufacturer. I tried contacting Netgear and they simply said I have no coverage and they can't help me unless I pay $89.99USD for 6-months support... Yeah NO THANK YOU!I would rather put that 89.99 towards a new modem.As a side note there has also been no firmware updates AND now there is a V2 and two newer versions since this one released.***DO NOT BUY THE CM1000!!!***
title: Failed just before 2 years

author: TheUltimateBohab
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2020
review_content: I got this modem to go with my open source Wi-Fi router on Wi-Fi it works excellent it gets the job done I have never had crashes but there's an issue with this and I can't for the life of me figure out what it is if you hardwire your computer to your internet whether it's through the Wi-Fi router or you plug it straight into this modem I get horrible download speeds on Wi-Fi i pull almost 500 hardwired I'm lucky to get 70 it makes no sense to me I searched all over Google and have found a few other people with the same issue but no answers it would get 5 stars if I didn't have that problem
title: Horrible wired speed

author: JOHN K. DESMARTEAU
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2020
review_content: The modem I received CM1150v up to 2gb/s did not assign IP addresses under DHCP with the exception of the laptop I used to try to change the settings. The laptop was obviously connected using an ethernet cable since this modem does not have WiFi capabilities. In addition, the Netgear Genie is anything but. It's a useless piece of software. So I got a Xfinity Gateway, and activated it in less than 15 minutes, hooked my whole house tri-band mesh WiFi system to and all my devices were up and running. So I returned the Netgear CM1150v modem. At some point I will spring for a different modem.
title: Did Not Assign IP Addresses and The Web Tool Is Useless

author: Crescendo47
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2020
review_content: I'd like to begin by saying this product was easy to install and is very good for high speed internet.However, it doesn't last long.It hasn't even been a full year yet and I've been having internet connectivity issues.  I have done my own troubleshooting and I even contacted my ISP.  They did everything they could to try and fix it.  They told me to contact Netgear for customer support so I did.Since the modem is still under warranty I thought I would be able to contact them and get it replaced.However, it apparently costs around $80 just to get in touch with customer support (It's free after 90 days after you purchase the modem).  That absolutely is really ridiculous!What is the point of having a ONE YEAR WARRANTY if after 90 days you have to pay $80 to contact customer support to ask them if you can get it replaced?  Might as well just buy another modem with that money instead.I will no longer be buying products from Netgear, nor will I recommend others to buy from them.  Terrible customer support experience.
title: Modem doesn't last long and the warranty is useless.

author: John
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 30, 2020
review_content: This is a fantastic modem and I will happily change my review to 5 stars if the Amazon listing is updated. Stating "4 x 1G Ethernet ports" while technically true, is misleading. This device has no routing capabilities and in order to use all 4 ports on the rear of the modem, you will need 4 static IPs from your ISP. This is not listed on the product page nor in the manual and took me digging into community support pages to find. If you want gigabit speeds on more than one device, you will also need a gigabit capable router behind this modem as multiple devices CANNOT be attached to it directly. This is a totally understandable limitation once you read about it, but should be listed somewhere by Netgear.Otherwise, I could not be happier with this upgrade, the modem provides the listed speeds.
title: "4 x 1G Ethernet ports" Is misleading for home use

author: Owen Brown
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2020
review_content: This works with Wave internet in Redwood City. I have a wired connection at around 800MBS, so it's great.I use it with a "TP-Link WiFi 6 Router AX1800 Smart WiFi Router (Archer AX21)" to get 230MBs+ over wifi through wood and sheetrock.I give them 5 stars but, what would be really awesome is if I could switch routers and modems without having to turn it on and off again. I was on the fence about leaving a 4-star review.Anyway, seems to work. If you're in the bay area, Wave Broadband has great technicians, I highly recommend them.
title: Works!

author: Steve Larsen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 31, 2019
review_content: Although I read all sorts of assurances in reviews here and even the technical support person at Netgear assured me this modem should work with COX voice, after an exhaustive effort on my part, I've learned it does NOT.  Cox no longer supports digital voice on modems other than the ones they supply.  Period.  While it worked fine for data, it never worked for voice.My second issue with this modem is that while there are 4 CAT5 connectors on the back, leading one to believe you have 4 wired Ethernet ports, this is not the case .  Only the top port is Ethernet out - all the rest are for some sort of LAN data aggregation scheme that did not make much sense to me.  A disappointment and not mentioned with enough emphasis in the product descriptions.
title: Probably a good modem, but will not work with COX Voice

author: TI99
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2019
review_content: Replaced a 8x32 DOCSIS 3.0 (ARRIS SB6190) which kept dropping the internet connection many times every single day.  The CM1200 is rated for speeds well over the 300MPS connection I have on Spectrum but is what you need to get away from the defective chipset.  My internet connection is now rock solid, never drops out or slows down.Spectrum changed the cable from the curb box to the house, then they ran a new cable inside the house (for a big FEE), then they blamed it on my equipment.  Get this modem and end your internet frustrations.
title: CM1200 - Rock solid 24x7

author: gslauren
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 16, 2019
review_content: I had a Docsis 3 Motorola, Netgear, and others. I paid for 150MG speed but never got over 50. I had Comcast send over a tech just to be sure my line was good, and guess what? My Modem/Router combo was my issue. I thought 3.0 was enough. In todays world where UHD depends on 50-60+MB, a 3.1 makes all the difference. I used my 5GB Router, bought just the 3.1 with 32/8 because of the way Comcast uses its bandwith, you need more than just 8/4 for great UHD and high speed, and my download went from averaging 47MB to just shy of 90MB. That is why my phones work better, my new 4K/UHD 75inch TV has a picture second to none, and there is no slowdown with multiple devices being used at the same time. OK, there probably is, but not as that anyone has told me. There you go, be smart, get a seperate high speed router and a Docsis 3.1 modem. It pays if you need the speed and bandwith.
title: This Gig Modem Will Speed You Up!

author: audra kalfass
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2020
review_content: I refuse to pay rental fees to my already too expensive Comcast bill, so I purchased this "super fancy" modem... It wasn't very easy to install, since out of the three computers in this house, none have an ethernet cable connection, which led to a very long conversation with Comcast to set it up. After setup, it was a terrible game of "find the best position for your modem/router" followed by "find the best position for the extender." Once the placements were established, we really started noticing the spottiness in connectivity, we're constantly switching channels and ultimately turning wifi off until the system is rebooted. It works for a while, but needs to be rebooted everyday. Comcast came out last week to check the connection, and basically said it was this modem causing the problems and we should just rent one from Comcast. I tried to access some support from Netgear, but they only offer free support for a limited time which has lapsed, leaving the only option to purchase support, at $89.99/6 months. So here I am, after spending $249 on this fancy new modem, either paying MORE for support which MIGHT fix the issue, or going back to rental fees. If you buy this modem, make sure you achieve 100% stability by the return deadline, or else you'll be stuck with an extremely expensive daily headache.
title: Unstable connectivity w/ 0 support

author: Rivky Hafter
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2019
review_content: i wanted a top speed modem that compatible with docsis 3.0 and future proof. the installation was simple, just called optimum  to authorize the modem in their network and was running smooth. but can't pass the 100mbs, they claim the modem sends error signals. they recommended their outdated modems . they are not up to today speed demands. i will be trying another motorola unit and if it does not work then i'll have to purchase their arris. unfortunately i don't have another ISP choice for my location.  why does netgear print  in their documentation to call optimum for installation if this modem is not fully supported by them?!!!!!!!!! they should put that will not pass 100mbps  with optimum.
title: not recommended for optimum

author: Jaime
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2019
review_content: So I recently upgraded my xfinity internet to 175mbps but was informed that to get the best experience I would need to upgrade my modem to something with docsis 3.1. I had an old arris SB6121 that cost me $60 back when I had originally switched to xfinity and it was capped at around 172mbps. I was hesitant at first to shell out the $140 but leasing it for $13 a month is stupid so I bit the bullet. I plugged the new modem in and called customer service to register it and was online within minutes! I did a speed test and got over 200mbps. The customer service rep upgraded me to 275mbps and now i'm getting over 400mbps down. This has tremendously affected my home network and when gigabit becomes more affordable I have peace of mind knowing that this modem is ready.
title: Worth every penny

author: Timothy H.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2020
review_content: If I could give zero stars I would.I have had constant issues with my internet cutting out or dropping off to a snail's pace. Like most people I assumed it was my service provider, Xfinity, but surprisingly they were a dream to deal with compared to Netgear. I've had Xfinity run multiple checks, they sent a tech out to replace connections and tested everything and the connection was perfect according to a very helpful tech but I'm still experiencing poor internet on a 75 MBPS line. After multiple calls and tests they suggested I contact Netgear to run diagnostics. HA, what a joke that was. Good luck finding a number to call that works without them leading you down a robo rabbit hole and hanging up on you because your product wasn't purchased in the past 90 days. I've spent over an hour trying to find any support and the only thing I haven't tried is Netgear forcing me to pay for the 'Premium Support'DO NOT BUY NETGEAR!!!!!!!!!!
title: I've never experienced so much frustration in my life

author: Doreen Streltzoff
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2020
review_content: This modem never worked properly.  it would cut off when I was in the middle of an on-line game or message.  It finally stopped (after 2 months) accepting the internet connection from my cable company.  I installed a new Motorola today, and it worked fine, connected immediately and I'm happy.  I am very unhappy that I cannot return this item, especially since I bought the service contract which is not refundable either.  I do not want this item in my home and will not buy another Net Gear product.  I will think twice before buying any more electronics from Amazon.  The short period to return is ridiculous.Doreen Streltzoff
title: This item may not work!

author: jane_doe
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2020
review_content: This modem/router is the bane of my existence. It fails terribly as a router.  Everyday it fails to deliver the internet to me.  I'm 3 ft away from it right now righting this review and have had to power cycle it back on and off twice to be able to load this page. I consistently turn off the wifi on my phone and use my cellular service, because this machine is so bad. I live alone in a small 1 bedroom apt and have comcast with 600 Mbps speed coming out of my wall and into this junk. And yet I can't load a page like ever.If you need to use the internet ever, get something else!
title: If you don't need to use the internet, get this modem/router

author: TJ in Seattle
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 15, 2019
review_content: Just got this installed and so far it seems fine.  I had decided to save some monthly dollars by replacing the Comcast modem (Technicolor XB6-T) with my own.  The Netgear CM1150V is the only 3.1 choice (including voice) that I see.  Setup went per Netgear's instructions, and the Comcast activation process also worked as expected.  Up and running in about 20 minutes.  Speedtests get pretty much the same results for the new model vs the old.  One big advantage with the Netgear is that it is silent....the XB6-T must have a fan in it, forcing me to move it further away from my workstation.  Very happy so far.
title: So Far, So Good

author: MyName
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2020
review_content: Felt uneasy buying Netgear brand to begin with due to past experiences. The unit died after 3 months. Hardware dies. I understand. What earned the product a 1 star rating is the heck I had to go through with tech support to get an rma, of which I get to pay to ship  their defective back and if I want it expedited would have to pay almost $20 for the return trip. No idea how long this will take getting replaced, but I have an Arriss docsis 3.1 modem arriving today. I will sell the netgear whenever I get it back and remember never to buy netgear again.
title: Died after 3months. Netgear support is horrible

author: Michelle in Portland OR
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2019
review_content: I replaced my older modem with this one because my old modem was no longer a supported version. I called my ISP after plugging in the modem, connecting my router, connecting my computer via USB and after writing down the serial number and mac address for the new router. It took about 5 min for the tech to add the modem to my account and to run a test.  Then I simply connected to my already existing network.  Note unless you also replace your router you just reconnect to your regular network.  Also note a few devices you own may not automatically reconnect.  For example, my wifi based security cameras did not sync. All I had to do was connect them via USB to my router until they reconnected. Telling you this so you have a realistic idea of steps you may need to take. Giving 4 stars for easy set up but could move up to 5 if it proves to be faster and more reliable than old modem.  Fingers crossed!
title: Easy set up

author: Mike
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2020
review_content: Died after 12 months of use. Just the amber network light stays on, even when not connected to my network. Thanks Netgear for a $160 paperweight. Also perfect timing since everyone is working remotely this day and age. Would not recommend it at all as this seems to be a known failure that Netgear won't do anything about. Going back to Motorola as I had one of their modems last over a decade.
title: Dead after one year.

author: thescarletterosedc
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2020
review_content: The version I got was *new* but from Amazon warehouse. Other than the packaging (which came as shown in picture, as opposed to the typical Amazon cardboard box), everything inside was new. I was on the phone with my Internet provider before installing it, and they were on the phone with me to switch to the rental modem to this Netgear one. The modem itself is so easy to install - you basically just plug in the cable chord to connect it to the wall, and the power outlet. Note that unless you plan on using an Ethernet chord, you will need to get a router as well.
title: Fast wifi and great price!

author: D and D
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2019
review_content: The CM1150V (the one that has phone jacks compatible with Xfinity voice) is an amazingly fast router!  It was very easy to setup and to activate on Xfinity following the quick-start instructions in the box.  I didn't have to call Comcast to switch it from my previous modem.  Basically, you connect it to the cable, connect your phone jack (it comes with two but I only have one line), and turn it on.  It took about 5 minutes to cycle through a couple of times until it was finally finished with whatever it does to boot up the first time.I plugged a laptop into the modem using an ethernet cable (one comes in the box) to be able to connect to Xfinity the first time and activate the new modem using a web browser.  After that I connected a Netgear Orbi Tri-Band Mesh WiFi to the modem (because it doesn't have built-in wifi) and got that up and running by downloading the Orbi app.As I would expect, everything is very fast and signal strength is very good all across the house.This is a very easy modem to setup and get running - just don't forget it doesn't have built-in wifi.  This modem plus the Orbi mesh wifi system is running super fast and was super easy!
title: Super Fast - Super Easy

author: Mike
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 6, 2020
review_content: The Netgear R8000 router I got along with this has already been replaced due to the issues that plague it. Issues that have long been known and never addressed. Now my Netgear CM1200 modem just died in the 13th month of ownership. My initial impression of both of these products was positive, but now I will never buy another product from Netgear again. They absolutely do not stand behind their products and do not care for their customers. I've wasted over four hundred dollars on Netgear equipment just to throw them out after a year.
title: Dead in month 13 - NO MORE NETGEAR EVER

author: Maximiliano Espinosa
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 8, 2019
review_content: First, this is not a Wifi router, you must purchase that separately. I personally have this paired with google WiFi router. I replaced an old surfboard modem that was 5 years old with this. What I noticed was a much more stable and consistent connection. With my surfboard the high points would still be around my peak download speeds but it would not be consistent. With this modem my speeds are always around the speeds I’m paying for from Xfinity. The install was super easy, it’s just a power cord, in my case a Coax cable for incoming signal from my wall, and an Ethernet cable that goes to my google WiFi router and a simple phone call to Xfinity to activate the modem.
title: Very consistent and stable connection

author: Jay
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2019
review_content: I use Comcast XFINITY 175 Mbps plan. When I used my old modem, Motorola Surfboard SB6121, the measured actual download speed was about 130 Mbps. That old modem was supposed to be able to provide as fast as 172 Mbps.After switched to this modem, with the same 175 Mbps plan, I got about 210 Mbps. The modem is supposed to go all the way to 680 Mbps according to its pacakge. But I guess if can go like 500. Still, much more that the package I am buying.BTW, the installation is easy. I even used the old power cord and ethernet cable of my old modem, as they happen to be identical. It took Xfinity about 10 minutes to fully recognize my new modem, but then everything was fine.
title: Good speed with xfinity.

author: Jake
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2020
review_content: I've never had a bad experience buying things from amazon, not once until now. This certified refurbished. Though I'd save a little money, hah what a joke! Not only was it still linked to someone else's account which took xfinity a few hours to figure out how to remove, its defective: keeps disconnecting from internet, will only allow 1 port to work at a time, will not send internet to my router. Only reason I upgraded was because I needed a new modem for faster internet.. Kicker? Yeah I can't switch back to my old working modem because its not supported under my new service so I have to use this till a new one arrives a week later. Lesson learned: don't by "certified refurbished" from amazon!
title: Complete Garbage

author: S. D. Ruttan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2020
review_content: This is a really substantial modem. The thing to understand however is that the link aggregation is a little bit tricky to get configured for those of us who use network security appliances like we do in the office. So be prepared to know how to setup 2 WAN connections to do this. If you have a directly compatible Netgear router or switch, apparently its just plug and play? We don't use Netgear switching or wireless access points so we cannot verify this other than what the disclaimers  and product reviewers say. However It has been pretty stable for the couple days we've had it in service. It is gigabit ready. It also is able to accommodate another local IP provided your ISP offers that service.  We have two so this is great to create consolidated networks for guest and mission critical applications.  It runs a little warm. This is to be expected because it has a really chunky Broadcom processor in there. My only real gripe is that for a 220 dollar modem they couldn't be bothered to make wall mounting an option? Really?  I suppose we'll have to make a stand for it or something... Other than that it's pretty nice. Kudos for the physical on/off switch and the  modest green LED's instead of those blinding blue raspberry colored LED's that come on most ISP modems. If you're prepping for gigabit in your area and you can't find an Motorola/Arris alternative,  check these out. I will revise this review if anything changes.
title: Beast of a modem.

author: datamatrix
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2018
review_content: This is the best consumer modem out there. It's not cheap and honestly it's not necessary... Yet. This is the option if you're looking to not need another modem in 10 years. 1 star off in the durability category because the stand is a tad flimsy but overall this modem is a beast.For you non-techy people out there: this modem will NOT magically make your internet faster. It can give you your ISPs full potential speeds but you're only going to get the speeds you are paying for. There is no magic pill for faster internet speeds, except cash and a willing ISP. If you're not paying for 1gbps service then a cheaper modem is probably right for you.
title: Future proofing.

author: M. Kelly
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2019
review_content: The NETGEAR CM1000 is an excellent gigabit cable modem. Setup was simple, but I encountered an issue getting top speed from my ISP. The issue was resolved and now I'm getting blazing speed. The small footprint is appreciated. The base feels flimsy, but it holds the device upright and if placed in a secure location, this is not an issue. The CM1000 ultimately delivers fast internet and that's what matters. Thank you, Netgear. Excellent job.
title: Excellent Giga Cable Modem

author: rmezei
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2020
review_content: It's a really great product. For the past 2 years I have only had to reset it once or twice.The app that comes with it has some weird red exclamation points, and from within the app I wasn't able to send a request to inquire what's going on with it. Also, I couldn't find any hint/popup info when I try to click on it.But otherwise, I had no issues with it. I am really happy with it.
title: Great product

author: Russ B
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2020
review_content: I bought this CM700 to replace my CM600 when I switched to a higher speed plan (1Gbps) with XFinity.  I did my research, XFinity said it was supported, it had 32 channels up and 8 down, NetGear said it would work up to 1.4 Gpbs.  Turns out that's only on some ISPs.  XFinity doesn't support this modem for anything that fast.  I was only getting 300 Mbps up and 6 Mbps down.  Returning it.
title: CM700 - Netgear says it's 1.4 Gbps, Xfinity only goes up to 300 Mbps on it

author: Chris S
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2019
review_content: Dude, I've gone through like 3 modems in the past year, all of them ending up faulty, slow, or something in between. If you pay for fast internet and actually want to get the speeds you pay for, this one did it for me. I've had this for a few months now and it is absolutely blazing fast with 0 trouble. Don't forget to reboot every once in a while!
title: OMG it WORKS!

author: Matthew Witzman
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2020
review_content: I purchased a NETGEAR CM1150V cable modem in June 2020.  I was able to work with Comcast to get this provisioned and setup properly after a few calls.  Unfortunately, there was a problem with the upstream data reliability of this cable modem.  The modem shows completely healthy but drops a lot of packets making the network connection very unreliable.I had Comcast out to investigate on several occasions and they tested my line and reported everything as clean.  The Comcast line test modem worked perfectly, and a new Xfinity XB7 off the truck worked perfectly, no lost packets.  So we established that the NETGEAR modem was defective by confirming two other devices are working great on the line.I opted to keep the XB7 and pay Comcast the $14/mo fee and my plan was to ask NETGEAR to replace the modem under warranty.  This is when is discovered what kind of company I was dealing with..I called NETGEAR and asked them to replace the modem and honor their 1 year warranty.  This is when the technician kindly explained to me that because 90 days had passed, they would need to charge me an additional $229 for a service support contract in order to process my warranty claim.  So NETGEAR will not honor their 1 year warranty without me paying more than the modem originally cost in order to process a warranty claim.I'm pretty sure this must be illegal under some state laws, but I am not going to give NETGEAR even more money to get warranty support.  So buyer beware, NETGEAR will not honor their warranty.  You will be stuck with a brick and have no way to return the product.I do give Amazon credit, they listened into my phone conversation with NETGEAR and recorded NETGEAR's refusal to honor their warranty and offered me a refund.  I would encourage Amazon to suspend sales of NETGEAR products due to these bad business practices.  If companies will not stand behind their products they should not be sold through Amazon.Please do not buy a NETGEAR product, you will be disappointed.
title: Beware of NetGear Products - Warranty Scam

author: Yup007
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2019
review_content: So easy called Spectrum gave them the device Serial Number turn on device they stayed with me all the way till device wifi drew signal and I was able to check on google it was working I said thank you they said thank you have a good night. Next step I downloaded Netgear Nighthawk app got into my device turned on Ipv6 to run with Ipv4 all is great! I did a combo my CM1200 is running along side of my Netgear NightHawk RAX120 Router 2.2Ghz Processor goes through Router setting like a breeze.
title: Perfect Compatibility for Spectrum

author: jbordetas
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2019
review_content: Talk about a bait and switch! The ONLY reason I got this modem was the fact that it had 4 ports that supposedly worked. the modem is fine, the throughput is fine, but it irrates me to have to go through this disappointment from what I used to consider a trusted brand. There are WAY cheaper options and while I do have a GB connection, i really did not need the port aggregation. This is not in anyway worth the premium. Shame on Netgear. Google this and you will see I was not the only one duped.
title: The ports in the back are NOT ports!

author: Adam Pilkington
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2018
review_content: I wanted to leave my review to confirm this modem, CM500, does in fact work with Xfinity cable cable internet service.  In fact, it works better than the modem from Comcast.  I have the 60mbps  plan and I was averaging about 50mbps with the Comcast modem.  The new Netgear CM500 is hitting 71mbps consistently.  And yes crazy easy to set up.  Unpack it. Call Xfinity tech support, tell them you need to activate your purchased modem.  ... Disconnect the old modem, give tech support the MAC and Serial number located on the bottom of the modem, connect the new modem, and then they send a signal to it and it works.  I asked them to take off the $11 rental.  Took about 5 minutes.  This modem will pay for itself in 5 months without that rental fee.  Totally worth in every aspect.
title: Yes it works with Xfinity cable internet service... If you don't have landline service

author: Gayatri Swamy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2020
review_content: It is exactly what it is: A Cable Modem with Two Voice Lines. The multiple Ethernet ports may lead you to believe that you can connect multiple end points, but that is incorrect.  Only Ethernet Port 1 can be used to connect a WiFi Router or a PC.  Do not use remaining Ethernet ports unless performing LAN aggregation. Not useful for most individuals.To make things work the first time, make sure Cable Modem is turned on first and wait until the cable line light turns solid green. Then turn on the device connected to Ethernet port 1 (WiFi Router or PC)Works well. Activation does require calling Xfinity/Comcast. Probably true for other cable providers as well. They will need the mac address etc toa ctivate which takes about 5-20 min, before you can connect anything to Ethernet port 1.The admin IP cannot be changed and can be accessed from the wifi side once all setup.
title: Note: Port 1 for WiFi router/PC. Remaining Ethernet ports are for LAN Aggregation.

author: Bryan P.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2019
review_content: I bumped up from a CM400 to this CM1000.  I was frequently encountering network outages on the CM400 that were only fixed by a modem reboot, and I wanted to take advantage of the faster speeds my provider (Comcast) can offer in my area (400Mb/s).The good: the modem has been working flawlessly, and I’m getting 400Mb/s.  Also, the interface is simple and almost identical to that of the CM400.The not-so-good: setup was more of a pain than it should have been; I still had to call Comcast, and then after seeing only 60Mb/s, call back and have them reprovision because the wrong boot file was in use. I do believe these were issues on Comcast’s end more than of the modem, but beware.  Also, the stand/base the modem sits on is flimsy and cheap.Overall though, I’m very happy with the product and to be getting 400Mb/s Internet.
title: Got me the speed I needed, but not quite perfect

author: Steve B
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2020
review_content: High end docsys 3.1 modern which is required for carriers providing plans of gigabit speed or more This particular modern will actually support more than 1gbit but I haven't had the ability to test it real world.  Installs easily and if there quality you would expect from nighthawk.  Mine was used as a replacement for the Xfinity/Comcast garage modern/wifi system which doubles as a public hotspot. Internet performance improved considerably when I used my own equipment.
title: Do you have Gigabit or higher? This is your modern

author: JellyBelly
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2019
review_content: Installation was breeze for the cm1200  Did not have the call my provider to install it. Once all the coax cable and Ethernet cable was plugged in my pc was able to detect it. Just had enter our provider log in code and internet was up and running.  So far no lags and connection has been consistent.  I do not have gigabit plan so I can’t test it for its full potential. To use all Ethernet ports you have to have plan that allows gigabit access with aggregate linking.
title: Great upgrade. No complaints so far.

author: RichardC
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2017
review_content: I have been using a Netgear router and Motorola modem for several years with no problems. In order to take advantage of the internet speed I'm paying for, decided to upgrade my modem. Since the router gave excellent service, decided to go with Netgear for the modem. And, Comcast stated this one was supported, so I ordered it. I disconnected the router and wired the new modem directly to my desktop. It literally installed itself when Comcast detected I was installing a new device. With my older modem, it required a phone call and you had to supply the modem's SN and MAC address so they could configure things on their end. OK, now the fun part. You'd think the next step would simply plug in the router the same way as the old one and it would work, right? No such luck. I followed Netgear's instructions to the letter and it still wouldn't connect to the net. I called Comcast for a bit of technical help. They said all was well on their end but it may be a communication problem between the modem/router connection. Here's where it gets interesting.... I go to Netgear's web page and register the modem. Then, I called their toll free technical support number. I was connected to a call center in India. I could barely understand the person to whom I was talking and realized I was in for an ordeal. As so many others have said, their tech help/support is a total scam. Even though you have a brand new product, they refuse to do a blessed thing for you unless you pay a certain fee. In my case, they wanted $139!! Let's do the math.. the modem was $79.99 and they wanted almost twice as much to give me a bit of support?? I laughed until I cried before hanging up on them. If this is how Netgear operates, I hope they go out of business and never heard from again. Their whole business model is a scam, a fraud, and probably illegal. It wasn't until after the fact that I did a bit of research on them other than the reviews here. Google "Netgear Customer Service" to see how this company operates. True, your product may work wonderfully (as did my router) but reading what they tried pulling on others literally made me sick to my stomach. You can be sure of this- I will never buy another Netgear product because of the sour taste this experience left in my mouth.
title: Since the router gave excellent service, decided to go with Netgear for the ...

author: JohnD
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2019
review_content: This modem is fast! I was getting 235Mbs with my old modem and now I’m getting speeds of 600 Mbs. I am really happy with my purchase and new data speeds. I was up and running with 10 minutes from the time I got my package from the front door to testing my internet speed. I highly recommend this Netgear modem.
title: Holy Smokes Batman

author: MarcusMiller6158
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2020
review_content: Easy to install. Plugged everything in and called spectrum to activate. Everything worked great until about 24-48hrs later. My internet speeds dropped from 200-400mbps to less than 25mbps. Reset my router & modem speeds came back up but dropped down again. Upon doing research online it appears that this particular model of modem is the culprit and no firmware has been released to fix it.
title: Doesn't work.

author: G T Rivs Sr
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2019
review_content: More and more the expense of cable accessories and adhoc fees were bloating my account.  The NightHawk Modem is great, flexible and easy to setup.  Do not buy a refurbished or Factory rebuild however, my cable service ran me through the ringer because they had listed the MODEM as the previous purchaser, in their database, and could not figure out how to delete it or change it to my name.  I had to purchase a new one.  AMAZON was the winner through that nightmare, as their customer care kicked in a was fantastic.  All-and-all, love the MOCEM and everything is working like a charm.  Mad props to AMAZON Customer Care!
title: Good-bye Cable Fees

author: Someone
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 13, 2020
review_content: I’ve had it round about 5-6 months. It was easy to set up, though I did have to call Mediacom to finish because the website given didnt work. It was good at first and served our purpose of allowing us to play red dead online without being constantly kicked. However, it is now not allowing our full speeds to trickle through. So I’ll probably have to revert back to our original problem as a sacrifice to getting our full speeds. Also, it’s not MoCA compatible. So beware if you’re a tivo user.
title: Ultimately sucks.

author: Jenn J
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2020
review_content: Purchased this on recommendation from our internet provider installation tech. Such a nightmare... very difficult to set up. Worked on and off, very inconsistent- when we finally switched back to the cheap box provided by the internet company, our service was lightening fast. This was such a waste of time...it took multiple hours on the phone with foreign text support, all for nothing.
title: Don’t waste your time

author: Anon
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 12, 2020
review_content: I've been very happy with the device up until covid started (<300Mbps DL speed worked just fine). Since most of us including me are working from home we  decided to get the 600Mbps plan from Xfinity. Now all is paid for and activated, but I don't get more than 250-270Mbps DL. I call Comcast, after some monotonous troubleshooting they tell me to call Netgear telling me its a manufacturer issue i.e. netgear's cm1000 doesnt' support speed greater than 300mbps due to some issue (which no one could tell me more about).I call Netgear which asks me to purchase extended support to get help ( product was purchased in 11/2018. So now, i'm locked in a year of contract for 600 Mbps knowing I can't get more than 300Mbps.Please avoid if you have Xfinity as your Internet service provider.
title: Beware: Doesn't work with 300Mbps+ Xfinity Plans

author: Jeremy Ewen
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 5, 2019
review_content: Absolutely love it! Totally above my expectation! Although my isp refuses to download the firmware that is available and they happen to be one of the company's that would allow the update. As if isps don't already bottleneck you enough. I cant download it myself cause it says my isp is responsible for that and when I go to call them they say they cant touch it. So what I really need is an isp that treats customers with respect and dignity that purposely forces clients to upgrade just to get a little bit more crap worth connection. Sad to say Spectrum happens to be the best in my area but they are god awful. Exactly like that South Park episode about the cable companies ripping everyone off cause they know they can. "Cause you didn't bundle the packages, oh you're thinking about switching companies? let me see if I can get you a better deal. Oh that's right we are the only company around......Sorry!"
title: Does Amazon have a ISP?  let me know

author: Jesse Logan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2020
review_content: Long story short, Cable modem was bad from day 1. Of you care to read hear is the long story....My service was 100mbps, but I was getting g 50mbps, so I bought this modem Jan 2019. After install got speeds of 70-75mbps, better and within range for spectrum. This last week started getting 35-40mbps and then 70mbps. Called Spectrum and increased speed to 200mbps, still only got 70mbps with more consistent speed holds, still no where near 200 that I was paying for. Spectrum sent a tech out next day, she tested everything changed fittings on coax etc. Ends up it was the modem, she installed the free modem from Spectrum and now have blazing fast speed of 200+mbps.
title: Bought a bad modem never delivered anywhere close to 100mbps. DO NOT WASTE MONEY.

author: An Amazon customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2017
review_content: Works.  Speedtest rating when modem is plugged directly into desktop exceeds the 60MB/sec download speed I'm paying for.Beats paying the $5/mo "discounted" rate my ever more greedy friends at Optimum recently introduced--with the shameless assurance that I saving on this "temporarily" reduced price.  For years, I'd been an Optimum customer and the modem was part of the service price that has now more than doubled.  Gotta love it when they rob you and out of the other side of their mouths profess "thanks for your loyalty."  Can't wait to see what the death of net neutrality will bring to my Optimum bill.Some of the comments here bemoaned the heat from this modem.  I haven't had it through a summer yet, but from the fall through now I haven't had any issues.
title: Pay a lot now, or a lot more forever to your cable company.  It works.

author: vermillionx73
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2019
review_content: I upgraded to this modem from the CM700.  Since my ISP is giving me 300Mbps, I knew this modem wouldn't really increase that since I was already getting 300+ already.  But with this new modem I'm ready for Gigbit service once it's available in my area.I was also attracted to this modem for its "Link Aggregation" feature to increase WiFi speeds.  That picture shows it with an AX8/12 and a big "2xGBps".  Too bad my eyes didn't read the fine print that aggregation isn't available until the next firmware update.  So here I am with new Cat8 Cables, a newly bought AX8 Wifi-router, but hung out to dry on aggregation until who knows.My point, if Link Aggregation is what you want, you should probably wait to buy this until the firmware is updated and it actually becomes available.  So for now, I'm getting the same modem performance as my CM700.I will update my review if/when the firmware gets updated.
title: Link Aggregation not ready as of 2/24/2019

author: Matt
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2020
review_content: My first CM1000 lasted about 18 months and then started dropping connection and rebooting itself - every few weeks at first, then weekly, then daily, then finally stopped working completely. When it works it works well and can handle advertised speeds. It's a very simple and straightforward modem to install and doesn't require any significant management. When the first one broke I purchased another and I still prefer it to renting a modem, but I'm not happy about the poor durability of the device. Expect to replace it every 1.5 to 2 years and you'll be otherwise satisfied with the performance.
title: Good while it works but ultimately unreliable

author: robroy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 17, 2020
review_content: Improved my speed dramatically. Was using the provided hitron modem from Spectrum and only pulling in 250mbps wired and 150mbps wifi on their 400mbps plan. Bought the CM700 modem paired with a Netgear AC2300 router. Now im getting 460mbps wired and 360mbps wifi in the fartherest corner in my house. Definitely recommend this modem.  No more Lagging in games or latency issues.
title: CM700 is an awesome modem

author: Frosty
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2019
review_content: Too complicated for me to connect without my current internet provider's assistance, and I consider myself above average intelligence in this area.  You basically have to call your internet provider and they will need to get the model and serial number specs from your modem so your internet service can communicate with your new modem.  This modem was worth it because I find the modem router combo that my internet service provides is inferior to what's available. Only downside is,  my internet provider is punishing me an extra $25 a month to have purchased my own modem and router, but I got to have something more efficient for my needs.
title: Better than my internet providers modem.

author: Mitch
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 8, 2020
review_content: I had an old netgear router, but when we all started working at home is just wasn't quite enough to give us all fast speeds. I have one of the newer netgear routers, so I knew it was time to upgrade this also. Overall it works great and sped up my internet by about 40 mgbs which was great as I was already paying for these faster speeds but was getting just under them. Also, got this used (cause what difference does it really make when its sitting on a shelf or behind a cabinet) and it shipped just as fast and was in near perfect condition. If anything the box was just a little beat up.
title: Easy and sped up my network!

author: Tax Mechanic (Ret.)
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2020
review_content: I had owned a modem/router that had begun to malfunction. A technician from my ISP looked at the unit and confided that his own home setup employed a Netgear cable modem, and that he personally avoided units that combined the router and modem functions because they tended to be more cheaply made and less durable. I took his advice and bought a Netgear modem and a separate router, and I am pleased with the performance and reliability. I'd much rather have bought the devices myself than have to pay a monthly rental fee for my ISP's equipment.
title: The device seems dependable

author: B. Culver
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2020
review_content: This modem was something I was really looking forward to. It did have some reviews explaining an existing issue with connectivity due to faulty hardware, but there were an equal amount of good reviews. I tried it out, obviously, and just after 6 months the modem was no longer usable. I started seeing issues around 3 months, and thought it was my internet service provider (ISP). My internet would drop when under load (10 or more concurrent connections). After a power cycle, the internet would work for a period of time, but I started experiencing micro-disconnects (best description I have). Where my connection would stutter and interrupt streaming, but not disconnect me from the streaming service. It would start to happen frequently (every 15 minutes or so) until a power cycle. This would generally resolve the issue for the day, but it would continue the next day. I worked through my ISP and determined that the issue lied in my equipment. I reached out to Netgear after reading that these models are made with faulty chip sets. They were beyond useless, and borderline rude about my call. The rep ran a diagnostic check, and because it came back “OK” there was nothing they were willing to do for me. They did offer a subscription to their Gear Heads program to SEE if there was anything else they could do. Offering a good will replacement or repair would have gone a long way. I started looking for a new modem, but I was weary of the junk being put out anymore. I remembered I had an old SB6141 that still supported my internet package. Surprise, surprise. I have not experienced the issue above since swapping them. I am extremely disappointed in this whole experience, and will put more stock in the negative reviews going forward. Please avoid buying this modem.
title: Please, Do No Buy

author: Mikey
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2019
review_content: BUYER BEWARE - Online Amazon description: COMPATIBLE WITH ALL MAJOR CABLE INTERNET PROVIDERS: Including certification by Xfinity by Comcast, COX, and Spectrum. NOT compatible with Verizon, AT&T, CenturyLink, DSL providers, DirecTV, DISH and any bundled voice service.Box the modem comes in: Not certified to work with Spectrum.If they can't get that part right, I have serious reservations about using this product. Their tech support is outsourced and horrible, the app directs you to a website that's been moved (sloppy work - someone should check the links) and the NETGEAR website leads to nowhere. It's up to you if you want to take a chance on a product run by a dishonest marketing team.
title: THIS MODEM IS NOT CERTIFIED TO WORK WITH SPECTRUM AS ADVERTISED

author: Nanuck Maine
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2020
review_content: The advantages of this modem over the regular Dosis 3, are the new WiFi 6 standard, the AX and the increase in available channels when the web gets busy.  I didn't want to leave a rating because I wanted to keep this best-kept secret in network throughput and increase in PING to myself.
title: Docsis 3.O vs 3.1 with Netgear CM1200

author: GA
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 1, 2020
review_content: If you are a Cox cable customer - read this before buying.This device has all of its information, including the connection status page, protected by a username/password.If you use this device with Cox cable, they will update the device firmware during activation. Once they update the firmware, username/password change and you will no longer be able to access any of the device pages, not even to see the connection status. Resetting to factory defaults does not help, as Cox firmware ignores them.So, you will lose access to your own device. The main issue here is that you will have no way to monitor the quality of your connection and will have to rely entirely on Cox (whose service will not be formcoming). Contacting Cox does not help - they have no answer to this.Wish I could return it, but not sure how, as without username/password the device is locked out.
title: Beware: Read if you are a Cox customer

author: C. Perez
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 7, 2020
review_content: This modem took just a few minutes to set up , first write down the serial number and MaC numbers found on the bottom of the modem . Next hook it up , plug in router and have a computer turned on . A screen will pop up all on its own on the computer and walk you though everything . It will now be up and running , next you will have to call Comcast to let them know you are returning their modem , at that time they will ask for the serial number and MaC numbers on the bottom of your new modem ......and of coarse they will try to sell you something . Nothing high tech and all works well .
title: The Best

author: Bob Harris
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2020
review_content: This particular unit is designed to work with Comcast. Once having disconnected the Comcast  X1 unit I then put the coax onto the CM1150V and plugged it into my UPS. It immediately began configuring itself with Comcast. Obviously Netgear and Comcast have worked out a great system. After about 10 minutes the unit was operating flawlessly. It has been at this point about 4 weeks without a hitch. And I'm saving $14/month.  Not bad.  I was not using the WiFi from Comcast's X1 anyway so this is a perfect replacement.
title: Extremely Easy to Setup

author: Max
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 17, 2020
review_content: When I received this modem and router in one I had to call my internet provider who told me that the serial number of this modem on someones account already. They had to call that person and confirm before I was able to use it.Other then that installation took not that much time, just had to call the manufacture and stay on line for a while.Since installed it works fine, but also gad to purchase an additional router since the signal wasn't enough for the whole apartment.
title: It wasn't new.

author: S. Remsnyder
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2020
review_content: Don't buy this if yo are a Comcast customer.  The PUMA chipset  drops out daily and requires rebooting.  I should have read the reviews before buying this. Don't waste your money, buy something else instead.
title: A piece of junk modem

author: Mayur
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2019
review_content: I bought the modem to replace my XFinity Modem+Router and as per the description, it listsVERSATILE CONNECTIONS: 4 Gigabit Ethernet ports give you fast wired connections to your computer, separate WiFi router, printer, game box, and other devicesBut then after opening the box and reading the documentation provided with the product, you can only use Ethernet Port 1 only and the other 3 ports cannot be used. So very disappointed with the misleading information provided saying I can use all 4 ports. If I can only use 1 of the port, why even provide the other 3 ports which is redundant.As per Netgears support siteEthernet ports 2-4 are covered on your Nighthawk CM1150V Voice Cable Modem because those ports are reserved for Ethernet port aggregation. Ethernet port aggregation is not currently supported for the CM1150V.So essentially Netgear itself is saying, we just just put 3 additional ethernet ports that you cannot use anyway.
title: Misleading description and disappointed with Netgear

author: Izzy G
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 16, 2020
review_content: Major speed issues, I recommend just buying whatever your router already is. With optimum I lost half of my speed, a whopping 150mbps slower than my original arrow modem. Save yourself the trouble and grab the arris 1602 if you want to stop paying that monthly bill. Have a tech coming, will update if speeds improve.
title: Speed changed, optimum service

author: Moe Faraj
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2020
review_content: With Xfinity now charging $22.00 a month rental on there low grade modem. It's a no brainier to just purchase your own.ROI in 7 months.Easy install remove each wire off your existing modem and replace with this modem power on and sign in with your providers login and password. Up in about 5 minutes.Just remember this is a modem only! NO WIFI.If you want wifi you will either have to purchase a modem with integrated wifi (recommend against) or a separate unit (always a better signal)
title: Great product

author: PunB
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2020
review_content: super easy to connect. With 3 Orbi satellites, was able to provide a mesh around my 5000 square ft house with no dead zones. Even able to get WiFi outside! The Netgear Router is sooo much better than the ones that come with your regular cable installation. That feedback comes directly from the cable guy who installed my Wifi cable.  Don't skimp on your Wifi. This is a worthwhile investment. Got it delivered about a month faster on Amazon than I could get it delivered by ordering from the Netgear site directly.
title: Seamless, Reliable Wifi? It's a no-brainer.

author: Scott H.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2020
review_content: Slow speed when hard wired directly to the back of it.  I believe the issue is with a warm modem.  It works great when cold but gets slower as it warms up.  Netgear tech support is blaming the ISP.  Not sure how to get a replacement.  Luckily I held on to the old one which works great but is old.Bottom line: Check your modem speeds before the return window closes.  When they fail, they don't necessarily stop working altogether but get progressively slower.  If you have a problem, expect the manufacturer to blame the ISP and vise versa leaving you unable to get a warranty replacement.
title: Bad modem and hard to get support

author: Thomas Gestrich
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 23, 2020
review_content: Worked perfectly for about 7 or 8 months then decided to stop working. I’m an IT guy so I know all the little tricks to keep these things running and nothing works. These things are designed to fail. Tried logging on to the modem directly and it refuses to do so. This thing is actively rejecting all attempts to fix it. Decided to call up tech support and, big surprise, I have to pay them for an “extended warranty” before they would help me. These people know what they are doing and know what scam they are running. Take it from a computer expert, don’t buy netgear.
title: Netgear scam ring

author: Brenda
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2020
review_content: I have a Negtear R7900 router.  I purchased this modem to get gigabit speeds.Unfortunately, the modem connection with the router is very glitchy (both Netgear products).  It took lots of trial and error sequences of reboots to figure out exactly how the two devices are willing to talk.I called for service initially and they were helpful.  However, the service was only for 90 days.  Now, I can't return it to Amazon and can't get service.  Despite lots of troubleshooting, I can't figure out which of these two products keeps dropping the internet speed.  I can't get gigabit speeds.
title: bugs galore

author: Jacob Echorus
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2019
review_content: With Time Warner Spectrum:This modem was impossible to set up and took 5 hours of trouble shooting to figure it out. On the CM1200 there are 4 Ethernet ports that each require a unique IP address from the service provider. Spectrum only sends one IP address unless you pay for a business account rendering only 1 Ethernet port on the 4 port modem functional. Even when using the single port for my router, Google WiFi, it was difficult for the router to accept the signal from the modem and required 2 hours of google tech support. After all of that, the Google WiFi only received 100 mbps when my old router provided 350 mbps. I am returning this immediately.
title: DO NOT BUY

author: Proud American
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2020
review_content: We were on the phone 5 different times with XFINITY to register this product...every time was unsuccessful.  We then had a technician come out 2 different times and once again we were unable to register this modem with XFINITY.  Very disappointed having wasted so much time and effort with this modem and it will not work with our service.  Be very careful if you have XFINITY and want to purchase this modem.  The "icing on the cake" was when I tried to return it...it took so many phone calls and visits that I'm now out of the return window.  So I wasted $63 and have an ugly paper weight on my desk.
title: WAS NOT COMPATIBLE WITH XFINITY

author: Dustin C
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2018
review_content: Works great we have mediacom and there provided modem was horrible it never got the advertised speeds we payed for which was 1gb and on top of that we was stuck with them blocking access to all ports and being forced to use there web Interface configuration page which was complete crap. We didn't want to spend the 2pp bucks for a docsis 3.1 so we downgraded to the 500 mb plan and got this modem I must say I'm impressed with the speeds I'm getting I'm peaking just over 600Mb downloads and can open any ports I choose not to mention it saves me 10 bucks a month modem rental I recommend to anyone on mediacom.
title: Great Buy works for Mediacom

author: Jeremy Hurtt
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2020
review_content: I couldn't tell you if this modem is any good. It just died a week after I set it up, through no user fault or error, and Netgear won't refund the money I spent on it.They'll send me a new modem, but not a refund. Problem being, THE MODEM ALREADY FREAKING DIED, which means your options if you buy a Netgear modem are a) wait weeks with no internet for them to send you a new one or b) too bad, shouldn't have bought a modem from a company with terrible customer service.I explained from the top, over and over and over, that I bought this modem for my mom, and that it won't even turn on when plugged in, it's just totally dead.  The lady on the phone STILL made me plug the thing in and run through a bunch of tests on a dead, bricked modem that isn't configured for my house. After an hour of this crap, with me explaining REPEATEDLY that I no longer have any use for the modem, as I had to buy my mom a new one to keep her online, the person on the other side finally tells me they can send a new one, but no refund, despite the two dozen opportunities I gave her to tell me this prior, instead of wasting half my work afternoon trying to test a dead piece of trash I already made explicitly clear I no longer had a use for.Buy from Netgear at your own risk. If the thing dies on you, you're screwed, unless you want to go completely without internet while you wait for the company to make you whole.
title: Terrible Customer Service - Left me with a 60$ paperweight.

author: Dylan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2020
review_content: Well it didnt work the first attempt due to comcast menus and poor xfinity setup menus and procedures. On the 3rd attempt it activated, and that just takes time to happen. Be patient and make multiple attempts far apart. This modem is faster than the Xfinity supplied gateway, for which you oay 3 times the price of pirchase over a year. Good product. I was able to swap them without calling Xfinity. As for the external router setup (required for more than 1 connection)  that also took 3 attempts and a couple reboots.
title: Great Cable Modem for Xfinity

author: Richard T
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 17, 2019
review_content: I purchased this to replace an older modem after upgrading my internet package with Spectrum.  This was on their list of supported modems.  It was an easy plug, call, and play setup.  First speed tests show I'm downloading at a peak of 600Mbps, and averaging 570+Mbps before it hits that.  Can't complain about that!Other than the "it works!" portion, the construction is simple.  It's smaller than I expected and lightweight.  It does only stand up, which I didn't plan for.  There are 5 green LED's on the front, one of which constantly flashes when connected, but they are not too bright.Side note: Caught this on sale with a coupon on top. Best Buy would not match the price with the coupon so Amazon got my sale.
title: Great for my 400Mbps internet!

author: Shiloh
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2019
review_content: We switched our service to the local cable company and I did not want to rent their  modem for 14 dollars a month. I told the guy that I would buy my own. He was very helpful on what to buy. He informed me that the 3.0 was going to be obsolete with the new technology they are upgrading to. He said we would need the 3.1 to work with the upgrades that would be happening within upcoming months.This modem is extremely fast and  connected very easily to the New WiFi system.
title: Extremely fast!

author: Jay T.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2019
review_content: Like other reviews have stated, I started having issues where my Internet access would intermittently go out after a couple months. After 20 minutes the connection would come back up itself, otherwise if I unplug and plug back in the power the Internet would return. I had a Comcast tech visit my home to run tests on the signal in my lines and test other things and they found no issues with the cables or Comcast Xfinity signal. So we narrowed it down to this router. Unfortunately it's too late to return the device since it's out of the Amazon return period.
title: Intermittently losing Internet after 2 months

author: Andrew Johnson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2019
review_content: I haven't yet found the cause but for the last 4 or 5 months this modem, which is only 10 months old, completely drops out 4-5 times per day noticeably, and the configuration panel is inaccessible during this time as though it has rebooted itself. The Netgear router it is connected to confirms there is no internet connectivity during this time, and this is usually the case for several minutes, which is long enough to drop gaming connections, streaming services, etc for the entire household. This modem, alongside a server, the router, and security system all run on a UPS together and nothing else is disrupted, so I am certain it is not an external power issue. When the modem works, it works fine, unfortunately it is enough of a hassle that I will have to eventually replace it.
title: Reboots 3-4 times per day

author: LEO EXECUTIVE
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2018
review_content: Received this unit to replace the refurbished Comcast XB6 router that was Bridged anyway.  Upon trying to activate automation wouldn't work.. Called Comcast XFINITY who after obtaining MAC and Model loaded the wrong bootfile. Seems they chose a CM1000 instead of the full model number CM1000-1AZNAS.  The other is Docsis 3.0 only which they started to argue it could not be used for their Gigabit tier.  Once after Repeating that they were wrong, they could not remove the profile and therefore had to wait 24 hours for the auto removal. Today retried and despite the English barrier {theirs not mine} and explaining the modem was brand new and not previously used, they loaded the proper bootfile and bingo.After it settled down, speeds were 986 Mbps down and blew away the crappy XB6.Just be prepared....
title: Comcast blunders as usual.....

author: W. Cruz
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 8, 2019
review_content: As soon as I received it, I removed my old modem and connected this one. I gave it like 10 minutes so that all the lights would turn green. Then I connected it to my MacBook Pro via ethernet cable, opened up Safari browser and it automaticaly connected to Xfinity's activation page. All I had to do was log into my account and it that was it. Didn't need to call them to give them the MAC address. It was so simple to setup. I upgraded to the Gigabit package and I'm very pleased with it.
title: Simple to add to my account

author: It's Mueller Time
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2020
review_content: After spending a pretty penny on this cable modem, I had high hopes for its support of Docsys 3.1. Then after a little over a month of usage, this cable modem would lose connectivity.
