It would just drop out and disconnect from the service provider. After a few days, the drop outs became more frequent until I had enough and tried to replace it with the same model. When I ran the same model, guess what? THE NEW CABLE MODEM DROPPED OUT IMMEDIATELY! The exact same problem on 2 identical cable modems! Ended up going back to Motorola. Much more reliable.
title: Bad reviews are correct. It started to fail after 2 months.

author: Tejay Simon
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2020
review_content: I’ve wasted 4 months and hundreds of dollars on this crap Modem.  I didn’t know but 3 months after I spent so much money on this junk this was the reason why my WiFi has been down.  I’ve spent hundreds of dollars replacing other internet equipment trying to get my WiFi to work.  I finally pulled this out and hooked up an old modem and now everything works great again.  Don’t waste your money on Netgear products.
title: Junk

author: Giant_Dragon
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2020
review_content: I just purchased a modem, but was having trouble with the router (both Netgear products), but the router is from 2016, so far exceeded from support.  My question concerned the router so I need to buy protection in order for them to answer my question.  If they help me then I have to pay.  I figured my question was simple enough I could figure it out myself, which I did.  Why pay $50 for 3 months if I don't need to?  Wait time was long, the first guy is there just to make sure you register your product so they can send you sales stuff (I assume).  I remain unimpressed with their support.  The products seem to be very good.  Still using the router from 2016, so that's good.
title: The products seem good, just don't have a problem after 90 days.

author: csadamonis
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2020
review_content: This modem was great while it lasted - but it didn’t last. Have had it for a little under two years. For the last month or so our internet connection began going in and out randomly. We tried everything and could usually get the WiFi back online. Over the last week, though, it got progressively worse and we couldn’t deal with it both working from home - especially my husband who is a teacher and can’t afford to just lose connection while in the middle of teaching class. Switched out this modem with another model and internet is now working fine - no issues the past few days since switching. This one was at the point where it wasn’t even turning on anymore when plugged in/power reset. Disappointing, but I guess nothing lasts forever.
title: Good while it lasted, but wish it had lasted longer

author: D Thies
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2020
review_content: Bought the CM700 a couple of weeks ago so that I could upgrade my cable service to 400Mbps/unlimited data. Installation at my end went well and my provider (Suddenlink) provisioned my cable connection for 400Mbps without problems. With my PC cabled directly to the CM700 ethernet port, my download data rate to my PC immediately jumped to 400+ Mbps. When I connected my Wi-Fi router to the CM700 and my PC to my Wi-Fi router, my download data rate to my PC dropped down to the 250Mbps range. I need a new Wi_Fi router to keep up with my CM700 cable modem. I have a dual-band router rated at 300Mbps on each band.
title: Works well so far

author: Bob
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2020
review_content: My Netgear CM1200 seems well made and capable of handling my immediate needs and hopefully my needs in the future, at least as far as any tech device lasts into the future.  My disappointment is in the 4 Ethernet LAN port design. My last 2 modems also had 4 Ethernet ports which actually worked, allowing me to connect the router to 1 port, phone modem to another, and CCTV to another.  All functioned.  The Netgear CM1200 as far as I can determine from the User Guide, FAQ on the Netgear website, and Community posts, has just 1 usable Ethernet port, with the second adaptable to double cabling on some new systems that double the speed.  I have yet to figure out what the 3d & 4th Ethernet LAN ports are good for, if anything.  Indeed, they only increase the price of the modem as far as I can tell.  I could have purchased a modem with just one Ethernet port with just as much functionality.
title: Good for WiFi, not so good for Ethernet LAN access

author: Benjamin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2020
review_content: Purchased this and TP-Link Wifi 6 AX1500 Smart WiFi Router to replace the Comcast rental modem/router since setting up Pi Hole I can't change DNS settings. I have a 300 Mb/s Download service and the first 5 test's after the super easy set up all average 340 Mb/s. This is amazing and the wifi speeds are better than before also witht he WiFi 6 on my iPhone X. I would highly suggest these two products for anyone who knows what they are doing. I connected to the web browser (192.168.0.1) and changed password and at the end of the set up, the new modem auto-launched the modem activation with xFinity and BOOM complete and ready to rock and roll.
title: AMAZING

author: Scott A Turner
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 3, 2020
review_content: This cable modem worked fine until 2 weeks after the warranty expired, when its ability to stay powered and stay connected to internet first became erratic and then failed completely. I expect a $170 cable modem to last at least 3 years, not just 2 weeks past 1 year.I ordered an exact replacement because the Netgear CM1000 is still the best for high speed broadband with state of the art features despite being unreliable. The fact that the new purchase is working perfectly  verifies that the previous purchase failed (i.e. the failures were not my ISP, not my router, not my adapters, not my computers, etc.).
title: Failed after 54 weeks, 2 weeks past warranty

author: abe normal
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2020
review_content: should have listened to all the negative reviews ... got this back in Feb when it was on sale, decided to put into use last month, suffered through sporadic disconnects, and today it dropped connection and would not reconnect ... luckily I had my previous, slower, modem I could go back to ... which for 3 years never really gave me any issue. I'm disappointed with netgear for selling product like this but I really do blame the chip which seem to have lots of issues across different manufacturers.
title: dissapointed with netgear

author: hox
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2018
review_content: Hello, I recently upgraded to this modem to take advantage of gigabit interernet offered by comcast. The out of box instructions did not work with xfinity, it took over 24 hours and multiple calls with their outsourced tech support for the modem to be recognized and come online.Now, my issue, is it appears my modem simply can't handle a large amount of connections, especially for smart home enthusiasts. Firmware version 3.01.04. I can reliably trigger the modem to reboot if i allow all 20+ of my smart devices to connect and saturate multiple tcp/ip connections, and then inititate a speed test ot large download. Something is rotten with this firmware. I tried different routers so the issue is simply the complex traffic. I suspect netgear is not ready for the upcoming deluge of smart home users requiring "enterprise" numbers of simultaneous connections.
title: Xfinity customer - reboots with any high traffic

author: D
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2020
review_content: I bought this in Nov 2018. We have been using it with Xfinity for about 2 years. About 1/month, my daughter will tell me the "internet is down". The modem crashes and I have to reset it and then it works for another few weeks, and then it would be down AGAIN, and AGAIN, and........AGAIN. I had a Motorola Surfboard before and thought that I would replace it to get faster internet, but it has been less than ideal. I have a lot of Netgear products that work fine. This one has issues. Grade: C.
title: Grade: C. Been using it for 2 years. Not reliable

author: ajv1407
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2019
review_content: The digital manual was conveniently located on Amazon which made set up a breeze. A simple phone call to my ISP and the modem was activated and utilizing my internet speed to its fullest capacity. I only have a 400Mbps, and the modem is rated for double that. I purchased more what what I needed to leave room for upgraded speed in the future should I choose to go that route. It has no problem running an entire home of google home Wifi routers (3).
title: Stop paying rental fees

author: Willie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 16, 2020
review_content: I didn’t want to rent a cable modem/router from the ISP for $16 per month for a year, so I bought this. LESS then a 2 month payback, not bad at all. Connected right up to the xFinity ISP service. Used a Cat 5 Ethernet cable to connect to the AC1300 router in the 1st floor study ( ISP home entry point is in the basement on the opposite side of the house). My plan is for 100 MBs and I’m getting 109 MBs over WiFi in the dinning room next to the study. Very happy and time will tell. This is a xFinity recommended device. :-D
title: Fired right up

author: Bob F.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2018
review_content: After replacing our 7 year old Motorola 3.0 modem with this 3.1 modem we went from 135Mbps to 168Mbps. Set up was fast, just plug a laptop directly into the modem,give it about 5 minutes to acquire the channels, then you will get a xfinity login page, enter your name and password and it will add this modem to your account. After a few more minutes you will be back online.But now it's too fast, the first month after we upgraded got an email from xfinity saying we were almost at our datalimit and would be cut off if we didn't cut our usage.  Had never got that message before so we limited netflix and hulu for a few days until we hit the end of the month. Now I don't see the point of paying for a new modem and getting extra speed is when you can't use it.
title: Much faster than our old 3.0 modem, but now we get emails saying we are near our data cap.

author: LWB
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2020
review_content: After nine hours on the phone with both Comcast and Netgear, both providing erroneous information and blaming the other for all four ports not working, I finely got to the bottom of the problem. In order for all four ports to work on this modem, Comcast must send four IP addresses with port aggregation enabled.  Comcast will not provide that service to any routers that are not rented from them.  For now, I am back on the rented modem with Comcast as I have no more time to give this project.  Eventually, I will go back to a purchased modem and use the ports on my Asus router or purchase a switch to get around the problem.  Buyer beware on this model if you hope to use all four ports.
title: Do not expect all four port to work with Comcast service.

author: Christian
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2019
review_content: Although the Wave Broadband website says this modem is one of two certified to work on their network, don’t buy it. Every month for 3 months I had to restart the modem to re-establish connection. Then in the fourth month it couldn’t hold an internet connection for more than 1 minute at a time. The tech support that came to my house said, “Netgear doesn’t really work with Wave. Buy an Arris instead.” Now I have a 4 month old worthless $184 brick that I can’t return.
title: Not for Wave Broadband

author: Amazbob
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2020
review_content: Xfinity has told me since someone has activated the modem and they are still an active customer, I will not be able to use the modem unless I can contact the previous owner and have them relinquish "ownership" of the MAC. What a croc!!!! Thats how their data system is set up. HOW  AM I SUPPOSED TO CONTACT THE PREVIOUS OWNER. Amazon is of no help. Just lost 3 hours of my life.
title: Buyer Beware

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 21, 2019
review_content: I am not impressed at all. Only advantage is that it has voice. But in the other token only one port has internet access. Meaning you can connect ONLY ONE device with internet. The ports are not real ports like my old modem/router, which had 4 ports I was able to connect four devices with internet access. Definitely not worth the money, Description really misleading.
title: waste of money

author: Ken Harbour
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2017
review_content: Netgear CM500 cable modem installation success with Comcast Xfinity!the Netgear CM500 cable modem is a fantastic addition to my home network system for internet access.  First, the modem was well packaged, well protected, but easy to open and unwrap.  Second, the modem is a beautiful piece of equipment, suitable for upfront placement anywhere in my home or on my matching imaginary living room piano.  But more importantly, it was easy to hook up and connect to my existing service provider's network.  Comcast Xfinity provides a feature whereby the equipment can be activated and registered using an on-line automatic routine, instead of having to call a service technician.  The on-line activation process was successful and worked fast and flawlessly, taking less than two minutes for the whole process. I followed the Netgear manual procedure exactly, and had no difficulties at all.  This cable modem is now connected to my home wireless router system, and is a proudmember and contributor to that.  Thanks so much to Netgear for creating an elegant, beautiful piece of equipment that works great.  My tested download speeds were even faster than my service provider stated they would be.  Thanks so much!
title: works perfectly, fast and easy to activate on-line

author: Cash
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2018
review_content: I was tired of my internet signal dropping when streaming Netflix or playing video games, so I decided to spend the extra money on a nice modem. That was a mistake. I've had the modem for right around 5 months now, and it consistently drops signal twice daily. Even better, the problem started a couple months ago, but the warranty for customer service only lasts 90 days, after which you have to pay for phone support (not that they answer the phone anyway)! I've checked with my internet provider, Cox, had multiple technicians visit to diagnose the problem, and every time they say it is the modem.Conclusion: If you want a modem that allows you to get high download speeds, this will work. However, if you want it to last for more than a couple months, look elsewhere.
title: WASTE OF MONEY! DOES NOT LAST!

author: truthorconsequences
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2018
review_content: This review is written about the "NETGEAR Gigabit Cable Modem (32x8) DOCSIS 3.1 (CM1000-1AZNAS), also, the Netgear (R8000-100NAS) Nighthawk X6 AC3200 Tri-Band WiFi Router."I recently upgraded my internet service to 500 mbps. My internet service is with Mediacom.This paragraph is written about the modem/router combo furnished by Mediacom for rental. I will not take your time and list everything about Mediacom's equipment. I will just say the following, Mediacom's modem/router rental is "JUNK!" Speed tests showed its performance all over the place, never giving what I am paying for. Constantly dropping the WIFI connections. I had to restart the modem all of the time. I had it up to my brows with their junk. That is when I purchased the "NETGEAR Gigabit Cable Modem (32x8) DOCSIS 3.1 (CM1000-1AZNAS) ."The NETGEAR Gigabit Cable Modem (32x8) DOCSIS 3.1 (CM1000-1AZNAS) so far is giving me the connection I am paying for. It is near constant 500 mbps in Speedtest. I have coupled the NETGEAR Gigabit Cable Modem (32x8) DOCSIS 3.1 (CM1000-1AZNAS) with the Netgear (R8000-100NAS) Nighthawk X6 AC3200 Tri-Band WiFi Router. This kitten purrrrssss! Excellent performance! No dropped WIFI connections! In short, this equipment works! What more can I say.Buy it! You will like it! You might even love it! :-)
title: The "NETGEAR Gigabit Cable Modem (32x8) DOCSIS 3.1 (CM1000-1AZNAS)" works!

author: Allison Sweat
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 17, 2018
review_content: I recently purchased this modem and a Netgear router to replace a 2-in-1 product made by Arris which was total garbage. I paid ~100 for the Arris product which was suppose to have wifi signal boost, produce up to 100 mbps signal and had a warranty but the product was defective. The average signal strength of the 50 mbps I was paying for was 1-3 mbps and that machine needed restarted literally everytime I used it. It was such a terrible experience and a loss of $100 because the "warranty" was to replace the product if I paid up to $20 in shipping fees! What a joke.  So I took the chance to try a new brand and BOY AM I GLAD I DID! The set-up of this modem and counterpart router was so quick and easy and I immediately started have signals well over 100 mbps when I only paid for up to 50!  Now I've increased my paid for speed to 100 mbps and I've ran tests on my router/modem just out of curiousity and it pulls up to 180 mbps at times! It's never below 50 mbps. The days of experiencing problems streaming media via firestick, phone, computer is over! I have 3 smart tvs, 2 firesticks, 3 laptops, 3 cell phones and numerous video games using wifi at any given time and I've never seen the modem/router even flinch. This product is a 180-degree turn from the comparable Arris product. I'm never using another manufacturer!
title: Unlike other products in this price range, this is worth it and better!

author: David L.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2019
review_content: Bought this to work with the Xfinity 175Mb plan. When I called Xfinity to activate the modem, Xfinity has two different model name for the CM500 in their system, one is CM500-100NAS, one is CM500v. If you tell them it's just CM500 (which is what it says at the bottom of this model) they would get confused. I ended up telling them it's CM500-100NAS and they were able to provision the modem and successfully tested resetting remotely from their end. CM500v is the model with voice port for your reference.
title: Working with Xfinity 175Mb plan

author: Fredrick J. Aley
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 26, 2019
review_content: I set up this cable modem rather quickly, no more than 15 minutes and had it working well until I realized this is the wrong mod m for my case in replacing my Xfinity modem from Comcast, since this new modem does not have wireless wi-fi that I need for my wi-if network.  I quickly chanced the order and re-purchased a new cable wi-fi modem which I received the next day after returning the wrong one to Amazon through UPS drop off. Received instant refund.  The new wi-if modem is working well so far and. Notice no difference from the original one from Xfinity.  The main effort was having to essentially re-install all of my Alexa devices, which took a very long tims. This is necessary anytime you change your network name or IP addresses for those devices such as when you replace your modem. Finally everything back to working but I would probably never go through that again since I had to reinstall so many Alexa devices, not worth it. Had to call Amazon for help with the devices.
title: this is not a WI-FI modem

author: RodoFourOhEight
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2019
review_content: Works great after getting this running. I purchased "renewed" product but this one was still linked to the last account that was activated on it. After speaking with xfinity and amazon support I was told to call back to xfinity support for third time to request for the device to be unlinked from the previous account. I was advised this would probably take 3-4 days.Since I personally knew someone who works for xfinity I was able to have it done the next day. As always you take a chance when purchasing renewed but the xfinity support told me that for amazon renewed the device I received was missed for performing the steps to unlink the previous account. Just sloppy work from the location that processed it.
title: May take some time getting this running.

author: C. Baker
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2019
review_content: When I first set this modem up, the speeds were blazing fast - consistently reading 1k gbps. My router (Eero) runs a speed test every other morning, so I noticed that the speed dropped to 500 mbps. I called Comcast to get a tech out, thinking they had throttled my speed. After a number of tests, it was determined that the speed dropped off after the modem. I’m outside of the return period, and now stuck with a modem that runs at 50% on good days. On bad days, I’m getting 30 mbps. Interesting thing is that the upload speeds have not dropped at all - consistently at 30-40 mbps.
title: 50% speed after 2 months

author: Rand Jones
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2020
review_content: I pay for 150mbps with Cox in AZ, bought this to replace my 3 year old CM400 which has only pushing about 80mbps lately. Plugged it in, gave my ISP the necessary details and had the thing up and running in about 15 minutes. Ran a few wired speed tests and got around 165mbps, hooked up my new TP-Link AX3000 (which I'd also recommend if you wanna dip your toes into Wifi 6/AX) and the attached screenshot is from my phone going over wireless, about the same result as wired. The thing does it's job, hooray!
title: Works as advertised!

author: John Ramsey
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2019
review_content: Got this modem to replace a DOCIS 2 modem for my Spectrum cable internet connection. Unfortunately i didn't research the CM-700 and see all the exact same disconnects and drop outs that others have experienced. As I understand, it uses an Intel Puma chipset which has been acknowledges to have problems and even a class action lawsuit is in the works. Stay away from this, extremely frustrating POS!
title: Stay away from the CM700

author: Alan Evans
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2019
review_content: The description of the CM1150V is a misrepresentation. It states there are 4 x 1G Ethernet ports. The specifications, also state 4 x 1G with multi gig port aggregation. What the description doesn't tell you is, ports 2,3, & 4 don't work. The Netgear support website states a firmware upgrade is coming. Doesn't say when. Had I know these ports didn't work, I would have bought a different modem and saved money. I am very disappointed with the false description.
title: Misrepresentation.....Very Disappointed

author: LaWeezel
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 25, 2018
review_content: This arrived, I unpacked it,  plugged it in, and it worked. What more can you ask? You do have to call your provider and go through a process of getting it registered, so don't plug your Wi-Fi router into it before that. And make sure that your provider's tech-support is available when you do this. That is, call during business hours. But the process was pretty easy. Internet providers, like Comcast, are very used to dealing with people who only do this kind of thing once every five years and don't know what they're doing. They are very good with instructions. If you are a typical non-technical user, don't worry.
title: Easy to install, worked out of the box. Excellent price.

author: Rusty
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2019
review_content: The modem offers 4 gig ports for your use.  Xfinity provides 1 IP address per residential customer so leave those little black plugs in the three bottom port, because each port needs an IP address to function.  Xfinity will only unlock the other 3 ports if you upgrade to a commercial account.  I run a computer, TV, Game console and blue ray  and planned on using the 4 ports directly and now can not.  Follow the trail and look at the facts, you have to take 1 gig port to a router then feed all your lines off of that so you will never get the data rate promised.  The modem works great just be aware if you are going to use it with Xfinity they will not let you use it as designed.
title: Shake hands then FIGHT

author: STEVEN
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2019
review_content: Worked flawlessly right out of box with Spectrum Internet.  Configured and up and running within 10 minutes using Spectrum's online cable modem activation.  Replace Spectrum provided Aris modem that was locking up once or twice a day when the internet speed was increased.  DOCIS 3.1 is the way to go.
title: Worked with Spectrum Internet

author: AJC
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2019
review_content: This modem was purchased to replace the Xfinity modem that costs about $13 a month in rental fees.I hate Comcast as much as the next person, but setup was a breeze. You simply call Comcast (from your cell since, if you have a landline, you'll lose connection when swapping modems), unplug the Xfinity modem, install the Netgear modem, was a few minutes, and viola, it's all set.It took about 20 minutes from beginning to end.Since installing about a month ago we've had zero issues with connection (we also use a Netgear router for our wireless network).All in all, I'd say this is a worthy investment for Comcast customers with both internet and landline phone. If you don't have a phone landline, there are other, less expensive modem options you should check out.Good luck!
title: Super Easy to Install And Setup

author: Tyler & Kayla
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2018
review_content: Great modem for mediacomBy TYLER on Jan 10, 2018 8:01:32 AMAlthough the CM500 is not on their list of approved modems, it is running just great on a Mediacom 60mbps Internet only service. I am now consistently getting 40mbps download and 17 upload, whereas I was only getting 20 download and 9 upload with their provided modem router combo. These speeds are perfect for my wife and I in our small home and the modem has capacity to increase up to the next two teir levels our ISP offers. Best of all it only cost me the equivalent of 6 months of renting so I get my money back quick and get to keep the modem. As a side note I am running this modem with a netgear n600 two signal router that I had and using netgear geni with it's free open DNS account for a great parental control experienc
title: Great Mediacom modem

author: Jim A
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2018
review_content: We started having intermittent connectivity issues across all devices and multiple routers in our home, which pointed either to our ISP or the cable modem.  The old modem was about 5 years old, which is the age I've seen similar problems in the past.  So I read reviews, ordered this new model, and it fixed our issues and has been running without a hitch for a month or so.  There was some delay in getting it to connect properly initially, and I got on the phone to Comcast Technical Support and selected the option to have the modem reset.  It took a bit longer after that, but finally connected and started working flawlessly.
title: Works as expected

author: Qwerty
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2020
review_content: Works great with Comcast xfinityDon’t forget that you need router as well (this doesn’t have wifi builtin). Router might need mac clone to work (mine did).You need to call Comcast if you are about to replace their modem (ask them to not remove the orig modem from the list, so you have backup if you mess up something)Otherwise, it is a modem and works. Lowers Comcast bills as you don’t have to rent. Totally worth it.
title: Works great with Xfinity

author: Crystal
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2019
review_content: I had to upgrade to docsis 3.0 and bought this one because it was affordable and had decent reviews. I did see others issues but thought I'd try it for myself. My previous modem was a no-frills Motorola and I rarely had issues. This model has continuously cut off my connection, sometimes for extended periods of time. I need to do work at home and it's the most frustrating thing ever. I just missed my return window and I'm so mad that I wasted money on this product. Not buying Netgear again.
title: The most unreliable modem I've had

author: Average Joe
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2018
review_content: Instant upgrade to the full 100 mbps internet we've been paying for. I bought an all-in-one cable modem router years ago to avoid the monthly $10 rental fee but technology evolves fast and while it was fine for up to 25 mbps, it often went as low as 7 mbps. Not exactly a value when you're paying for much higher speeds. When I finally got this cable modem working (note: you absolutely need a laptop with an ethernet socket or a full pc plugged in temporarily for configuration which may not be easy in your living room when most laptops are all wireless now) and plugged in to the separate router, it got as high as 120 mbps. I felt like The Flash. Fastest man alive on the internet. Worth every penny.
title: Sorry, Flash. There's a new speedster in town.

author: Ashley Feith
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2020
review_content: The final selling point on this product for me was that it advertised for Xfinity customers, you wouldn't even need to call to activate service- the whole install and activation could be done online yourself.Wrong.I receiving a "sorry, its not working" message from the activation site and was told to call customer support. The phone line was automated that refused to push me along in the line to a rep until I reset my modem. Which I did. Waited 10 minutes for a call back and didn't receive one. Used the chat feature for 40 minutes with a rep who didn't explain why it was taking so long to register the router. Tried to activate it again, and it wouldn't work. Battled through the phone service again to get a rep and spent an hour on the phone with him because apparently my modem was ALREADY REGISTERED TO ANOTHER USER. This is supposed to be a brand new item. If I was interested in purchasing a used modem, I would have spent way less than $59 for it.Finally after 2 hours of phone calls, they were able to override the info on the modem, register it to Comcast, and activate it remotely. I am disappointed because I feel as though I did not receive what was advertised: namely, a NEW modem that WOULD NOT REQUIRE CALLING COMCAST.
title: Not as easy as the description made it seem

author: Brett Pellegrin
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2018
review_content: This product works exactly like it should. Some modems can be a pain to setup, but this one was easy as can be. Comes with an ethernet cable in the box (I believe it is 5ft long for those wondering). It does not come with a coaxial cable, which you will need to set this modem up. So if you don't already have one, I suggest picking one up on Amazon if you purchase this router.Other than that, this modem has run amazing so far. I pay for 100mb/s internet and with a wired connection I'm getting about 115mb/s download and 12 mb/s upload. Using my WiFi, I'm getting 105mb/s download and 10mb/s upload. Needless to say, this thing has impressed me.
title: Easy setup and fast internet speeds at a good price

author: RL
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2020
review_content: Product description is misleading. It says 4 gig ethernet ports available - in reality you can only use 1 port. Spent hours with Tech support including multiple calls into my internet provider to finally be told that the other ports can only be used in some weird aggregation mode ( I didn't understand the mumbo jumbo). Why not just buy the cheaper CM1000 then with one port..Bottom line - for most folks, this does not work as a multi-port router and only one of the ethernet ports is usable to then connect to a different router.
title: multi port does not work

author: Technologies8
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2019
review_content: trash.  it literally crashed twice a weekreplaced with CM1000 and not one problem since.do not waste your money on these intel chip modems
title: do not buy intel modems

author: Boomer27
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2018
review_content: First, I’ve been in networking for 25 years most recently running a group doing L2/L3 SDN development.  I just moved on to another company and got rid of the Comcast Business service and went with their GB offering.  I was using an Arris Docsis 3.0 cable modem into an Orbi network with 6 nodes covering ~6000 square feet.  I have over 30 devices connected to the network and do everything from video conferencing, Roku, AppleTV, Ring, Nest, PS4 and VoIP just to name some of the services I run.  I also live in a canyon and I don’t have mobile phone service, so my mobile runs over my network, I’m definitely not suffering from the cobbler children scenario and I’m very picky when it comes to my network.When I got Comcast GB, I was between their business service and the new service so I used their Comcasts cable modem for a week, made by Netgear.  It ran hot, provide slow service (using Speedtest and doing my own TraceRTs) and I turned their wireless service off to help stabilize the box, however, the box rebooted constantly.  To replace it I originally went with the Arris 8200.  Over the course of two months the network would go down randomly multiple times a week and usually with my son yelling “the network is down again” during Fortnite.  I looked at the logs, nothing. Turned features on the Orbi off after reading their forums, didn’t work (not to blame but poor advice).  Hard wired Roku, AppleTV, again reading forums, didn’t work.  I had Comcast specialists come out check the wiring, look at the logs on their end, nothing.  I finally concluded mostly because there was nothing else to try that it was the cable modem so I purchased the Netgear CM1000.Installation:  I followed the poor instructions included with the modem and nothing, it showed connected but hardwired I wasn’t able to get anywhere.  On my third try I decided to call Comcast support and have them install it.  Gave them the mac address and my network dropped (I knew this would happen since again my network is my only source to the outside communications world).  I noticed this time that the lighting sequence was different so I gave it some time, hardwired into the modem and all was well.  I connected and booted the Orbi and the network has been up and stable since then, no random reboots.  I run daily Speedtests and have noticed ~10% in overall performance from both wired and wireless devices over the Arris, however YMMV.Pros:- Works and I haven’t had the random reboots- By my measurements ~10% faster- Like the black over the Arris 8200 whiteCons:- It does run a bit hot but nothing I’m worried about- Didn’t set up out of the box with Netgear saying in their documentation that if you have problems call the cable provider, poor customer service.  Definitely the Arris was easier to set up.
title: Fixed my random rebooting problem

author: Brett Casey
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 23, 2019
review_content: Searched wifi modem router combo and this popped up, I got to excited I guess and purchased, didnt realize until I had it hooked up it wasnt wifi. I know I should have read the description carefully, which I learned a frustrating lesson, but my ongoing frustration is why does this piece of equipment show up when I specifically searched WIFI? Waste of time.
title: Wtf?

author: DMAN
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2020
review_content: The CM1150V has only 1 usable port even though it physically has 4 total Ethernet ports.  Ethernet ports 2-3 are for ethernet port aggregation, you can't actually connect a device like a Xbox to them.  I was pulling my hair out for couple of hours trying to understand why my wired devices would not work.  Might be obvious to a techie, but wasn't to me.It is a fast, easy to install modem.  Great download speeds, plan max. Going to add a multi port switch to it for my wired devices so don't have wifi loss.
title: Only 1 usable ethernet port but fast easy to install modem

author: Raptor
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2019
review_content: I decided to replace my ISP provided modem with this Netgear solution.  I’ve had some issues with a couple of my ISP’s cheaper, older modems which they had provided.  Likely some overkill for my purposes, and therefore pricey for my needs but it seems to work well so far.  Pretty easy to setup, and I like that I can logon to this modem to reboot it if needed.  My prior modems had stopped automatically providing an external IP address whenever I rebooted my router, forcing me to cycle power on the modem.  This unit provides the IP upon router reboot.  I spent more than I wanted to here, but am generally pleased with the performance so far.
title: Pricey, but works

author: Elijah
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 30, 2019
review_content: Bought this modem when I upgraded my Xfinity Internet speed to their top gigabit plan (1000mbps) which requires a DOCSIS 3.1 modem. This was one of two compatible modem listed, so I didn't really have much choice. After an hour long call with Xfinity support to get the modem activated (They will ask for your account number and the modem's mac address so have those ready in advance), everything has been great. Been hitting gigabit speeds no problem over Ethernet, have yet to encounter any buffer bloat, etc. Besides the initial hassle of getting the modem activated (Not Netgear's fault of course, Xfinity has always sucked), haven't had a single issue. I have it connected to a Unifi USG Pro serving as my router.
title: Great modem (But horrible activation process with Xfinity).

author: Chris Wagoner
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2019
review_content: Check with your service provider before buying but if they do use this one, it is very easy to install and works great. Have an XBox and PS4 and computer gaming all going at the same time and very little to no lag at all.Easy to install and took all of about 5 minutes to hook up, called my cable company and done! Easy as can be.I wanted to get rid of cable TV and Cable home phone and save some money. SO I dropped Phone and TV and went to just internet. Then got a streaming service to replace Cable TV. PlayStation Vue. Looks and acts like Cable TV but 1/4 the cost!Cut cable, get this MOdem and really reduce your cost of TV and over all services.
title: Works for Cable Internet, COx Cable and many others..

author: David W
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2018
review_content: If you have a Netgear router or Netgear wireless router like a Nighthawk R7000 and don't feel like renting your modem from Cox, then this is THE modem you want. This is docsis 3.1 and backwards compatible for docsis 3.0. Meaning that it'll serve the purpose of whatever type of internet service you have with Cox, this can handle it including gigablast. Basically you're future-proofing your home gear for the next few years and it'll pay for itself within 18 months compared to renting it.My wireless speeds are now up to par since moving to the same brand modern as my wireless router.
title: Can't go wrong.

author: Mark Simmons
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2018
review_content: I've always been a customer-owned device kind of person, so I replaced my Arris Surfboard DOCSIS 3.0 with this when I moved up to a gigabit plan.  I've not been disappointed.  Works great with a hardware-offloaded Ubiquiti ER-X, I'm getting fantastic speeds down.  RCN isn't the greatest with uploading, but that's no fault of the modem.  There's nothing like downloading games from Origin at 60 MegaBYTES a second while three other people in your house are streaming media...
title: Working brilliantly with my RCN gigabit

author: T. Francisco
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2020
review_content: Was leasing a gateway from Comcast Xfinity for $13 per month and wanted to stop giving them more of my money. Looks online and found that this is a supported voice modem for my Comcast plan. Activation was very easy and runs a little faster than the leased gateway. Paired it with my own router and everything is much better than Comcast Xfi console.
title: Cutting from more from my internet bill.

author: Sometimes reviews things
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2020
review_content: Worked as advertised for four months but then failed, and I needed to replace. Netgear support was cheerful and helpful, but “free replacement” program required me to mail modem to them and only then would they send new one to me—eg, no Internet for a week or so. Absurd solution. Unhappy with this purchase.
title: Failed after four months

author: B
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2020
review_content: I bought this item refurbished and have only have trouble with it. I missed the exchange window and now I'm stuck with it. It works ok and then loses signal. Twice a week. I would think twice about buying refurbished. Even from Amazon.
title: It might be good? Not reliable.

author: Jdiesel77
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2019
review_content: I got this to replace the modem from Comcast. I am now saving $13/mo. for the modem PLUS I bought 3 Roku's and I am using the Xfinity App, so I am saving $10/mo PER box, or $30/mo. + $13/mo. = $43/mo.= $516/year.  That's real money. It's easy to install.  Just remember, this is NOT a router.  You will still need a wireless router on top of this for a WiFi signal.  Other than that, by with confidence and stop wasting money on modem rentals!
title: Saves me Money

author: T. Courtney
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 11, 2020
review_content: Went to Comcast Triple Play and needed another router for the phone. Chose this one and it only worked for 6 months. Wi-fi signal kept going out overnight. We thought it might have been Comcast updating the bandwidth due to kids doing virtual learning. Unfortunately the router then completely lost the wi-fi signal. Troubleshot the eero router, NightHawk modem, Comcast signal and came down to the modem. Replaced it with an Arris and my wi-fi came back immediately. Also unfortunate is the fact that I can't get a refund on this.
title: Lasted 6 months, then died.

author: Kasey
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2019
review_content: For the amount, I'm upset that it didn't last a year.. the tech support guy from my ISP said he would be shocked if it was my modem since I'd only had it a year.. I bought it last April but didn't install it and use it until around August of 2018. Now at the beginning of July 2019, it won't work. I tried everything else to make my internet work including calling tech support at my ISP. The only thing that worked was switching the modem out with a different one and it worked immediately. Wish I could get my $100 back... totally NOT worth the money.
title: Didn't last a year

author: Queen Lyrica
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2020
review_content: This thing is absolutely horrible. It has no reach. Gotta be right up on it dang near to get connected. I have it running with an even more horrible Tenda router. I even bought a WiFi booster and still no reach. And it’s tiny as heck. Over half the size lesser than my rental modem. I think I wanna keep paying the fees and return this.
title: Soooooooooo....... where’s my internet signal???

author: Benny G LaRocca Jr
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2019
review_content: Couldn’t get much over 100mbs with my old modem hooked up to my nighthawk wireless router. With this modem, I’m not getting over 400mbs. Great products. Absolutely love the nighthawk line!Update 12/11/2020- I’ve upgraded my internet package to Spectrum Gigabit which granted is not true gigabit but let me tell you, with this modem and the setup I’ve created, this baby screams. Wireless speeds are averaging 600-700Mbps, and wired are 950Mbps. That’s with 37+ devices on my network at any given time. I literally see no lag streaming multiple 4K streams on numerous TVs, 10 cameras attached, Asustor Nas running 24/7. Couldn’t be happier. Thank you Netgear for making great products. ( not including Arlo Camera’s, more so their wireless hub station technology is junk )
title: Freaking Awesome!!!

author: Daniel Alfaro
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2020
review_content: I went with this modem because I was attracted to the idea of having my TV, gaming console, and WiFi router all hardwired to the ethernet ports but I come to realize that this is not possible.After doing some research and from what I could understand, there is no way to have the setup I intended to have. I'm giving this modem one start because the information stated on the page makes it seem like the multiple Ethernet ports can be used when this is not the case.In closing, do not buy this modem for the extra ports.
title: Only one Ethernet port works on mine, and so on yours if you buy one!

author: D.J. LaForge
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2019
review_content: I'm torn on how to rate this modem.  The WiFi signal is excellent and the modem produced higher speeds than the Xfinity modem that we were trying to replace.  However we ultimately had to return it due to it not being fully compatible with the Xfinity TV service.  Picture quality on the TVs in the house, even the ones which had only a coax connection and were not connected to the modem, dropped significantly.  Apparently this is due to the Xfinity modem using MoCA which is a way of layering a data network over the coax wiring in the house.  The Xfinity TV receivers, again even the ones without a data connection, use this MoCA network to supplement the signal being delivered by the coax.  So long story short, don't buy this modem if you have Xfinity TV
title: Does not work with Xfinity TV

author: Weebec
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2020
review_content: We have had this modem for ONLY 4 months and today it stopped working. After spending almost 2 hours on the phone with a representative who could care less with our satisfaction, they are sending a new modem. I will NEVER buy another Netgear product!
title: Unreliable

author: Coto Pete
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2020
review_content: This replaced an older modem furnished by our cable provider (Cox).  We have fast internet (Cox calls it gigablast) and this modem seems to be able to handle it well. With smart home devices, smart TV's, etc. we have 37 devices connected to our Linksys mesh network, so a good modem is critical.  We don't have to pay modem rental either.  Bottom line, I am pleased.
title: Fast and Reliable

author: rachel grizzaffi
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2020
review_content: I bought this to replace the modem that my internet company uses, to avoid the monthly fee. Trick is, this is the unit they told me to buy...but if it’s not the dual/modem and router...it’s just an expensive piece of equipment you bought yourself because you still have to use their router. The dual combo was almost 500 which during furlough/covid I just couldn’t afford the whole package. It’s supposed to be the recommended piece of hardware for wireless home network, I just couldn’t use it at this time, so I didn’t want to give the equipment a bad review, just a heads up for the not super technical people like me that purchased it unnecessarily.
title: Didn’t Use

author: Debbie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2019
review_content: I've been using Netgear products for a long time. Recently upgraded to an Orbi system in my home and absolutely LOVE it! However, I soon realized that my 5 yr. old Netgear modem wasn't keeping up with my increased speeds (over 200) and was cutting out more frequently than I could deal with. Rebooting it was getting to be a pain. Decided to upgrade the modem with the CM700 and scored a great deal on Prime Day. This was very easy to install and it only took a few minutes on the phone with Spectrum to get it activated. We were back up and running in no time and my speeds/strength are impressive! Love Netgear!
title: Netgear Rocks!

author: Eric N.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2019
review_content: Great modem on my 400Mbps Network! I had to get a replacement from a big box store as the one I ordered here would not work on my Spectrum Account, (If you look on the box it will not be compatible with Spectrum and no logo also. I went on Spectrum's List of Compatible Modem and for the CM1000 it has to be Version 2! The one I purchased locally did in fact show Spectrum's Logo right on the box. I installed and it connected to Spectrum's Network right away and great speed (See photo from SpeedTest App) It is a great High Speed Modem for over 400Mbps!
title: Check Box for Spectrum Customers! (V2. 0)

author: Dr. Bob
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2020
review_content: This is the top of the line (as of august 2020) Cable modem - can handle port aggregation for up to 2GB/s on the private side.  It absolutely smokes on speeds.  There is no wifi on it however so you will need a router (which you should anyway).I did not require Tech Support so I cannot comment on their support.  However, I will tell you the error logs are fantastic for troubleshooting and keeping Comcast/AT&T in check when they try to blame your equipment for being the fault of network issues.
title: Top of the line Cable Modem for gigabit

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 1, 2019
review_content: From the product description“VERSATILE CONNECTIONS: 4 Gigabit Ethernet ports give you fast wired connections to your computer, separate Wi-Fi router, printer, game box, and other devices.”Unfortunately, a quick google search will reveal this not to be true. Ports 2, 3, and 4 are currently ‘reserved for future use’ and are not at all functional. This is unfortunate, as it was one of the primary reasons I bought this router. Sounds like the product was not quite ready for market. Seeing as it’s called out as a feature multiple times in the description, I feel a bit ripped off here, and wasn’t expecting this from a company as established as netgear. Guess we’ll have to turn our hue lights on the old fashioned way for a few days.The router itself seems ok, aside from taking 3 calls to comcast and over an hour to activate, but this advertising is distasteful on such an expensive dollar purchase.
title: If you are expecting 4x1 gig ethernet ports as advertised, you may be disappointed

author: Anonymous
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 25, 2018
review_content: Getting only 450Mbs with Xfinity Gigabit.  This modem only has 256MB of memory compared to the other recommended Xfinity compatible routers which had (512GB and 1GB).  The other routers also had multiple ethernet ports.  Wish I had gone with another modem for $10 or $20 more.Along with this modem I purchased the Nighthawk X4S R7800, another regret due to the buggy firmware.
title: Slower speeds with this modem

author: MD
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2019
review_content: Upgraded to this modem after upgrading Xfinity internet to 1gbps.  First modem the power light was blinking.  After spending over an hour on the phone with Xfinity they pointed out that the power light should go from blinking to solid within the first few seconds.  Why this took an hour to pull out of them only proves how sadistic they are over there.  I called Netgear to confirm.  Tech support refused to answer the simple question and instead made me run through a series of resets and reboots only at the end to confirm that the blinking power light was an issue.  Ugh.  Amazon's return was a breeze, new one works great.  For now.  Miserable customer service though.
title: First DOA.  Second working well.  Blinking power light = dead.

author: Kindle Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 25, 2020
review_content: Our old modem was too slow. This was a really great price. Costco was more than double the cost. Fry's Electronics is a hassle to get around. It was delivered the same day. My son says it is better for computer gaming. I can now watch Last Week Tonight with John Oliver. Life is good.I am really not the tech guy in the house. I were told by our cable provider what to buy. I got it ordered and delivered same day--within hours. It was not hard to install (watched son do it, read a book and sipped tea).
title: My son installed it for me

author: The Rondeau Family
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 10, 2019
review_content: We ordered this modem in September of 2018, so just over a year ago and it completely died on us yesterday.  We had to have Comcast out to diagnose the issue and they said the modem was complete junk.  I’m so upset that we spent so much money on this nice modem just for it to die a little after a year.  I won’t be buying Netgear again!
title: Died

author: Carter
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2020
review_content: The last couple months in my house:  Family complains about internet, I reboot my Netgear CM1150V.  It works for an hour, or a day.  I call Comcast, they send a "refresh" signal, it works for an hour, maybe a couple days.  I ping google's DNS: 10-15ms for a while, then a few timeouts, then back to 10-15ms, then timeouts for a few minutes.  I've scheduled two appts with comcast, and for both they called back saying they "found something upstream - does it now work?"  It does, for a while.  Then it doesn't.  The voice phone service cuts out as well.I read about the Intel Puma chipset problem in many of these reviews - it sounds awfully familiar.  On the way home I picked up a broadcom-based motorola mt7711 and just hooked it up.  A solid 10-12ms ping replies for the last hour.  I hope it works.
title: Replaced it in less than a year

author: Kat
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2019
review_content: I just got this modem last week so I can’t speak to the overall rating of the product but want to help anyone with similar installation challenges (because who wants to pay Comcast $70 for a technician to come out?!). My problem was not with the modem itself but instructions definitely could have been written a bit more clearly.1. Couldn’t connect coaxial cable to modem - turns out the pin on my coax cable (which I inherited from a previous tenant) was too long for the shallow opening in the modem (you can check this by inserting a safety pin in the bottom knob of the modem to see how far it goes). I ended up trimming the inner pin on the coax cable to the appropriate length, until the outer part would screw around the modem. There is probably a better/safer tool out there but I used cuticle trimmers as I was afraid pliers would damage the wire.2. Once I had modem connected to coax and called Comcast to initiate the connection, the second-to-bottom internet connection light (the one that looks a bit like Saturn) would still not turn on. After hanging up, much cursing to my partner about telecom monopolies, and about 20 minutes of just leaving it alone, I noticed the connection finally activated by itself (the Comcast person didn’t tell me there could be such a lag.)Shout out to the excellent Netgear customer service guy who helped me figure out the coax thing :)
title: Modem is great but coaxial cable gave me trouble

author: Bob Ring
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2020
review_content: Young adult daughter got to replace her rented modem/router from WOW internet service. Very easy setup and step-by-step instructions. Not sure how helpful the tech support is, but all the contact info is on the pamphlet that came with it and looks very easy to access. Compatible with WOW internet service, just need to call their customer service to get it registered to your account. Using with eero wifi router. Super easy to set up and monitored right on your phone through the app!
title: Easy set up, fast speeds & WOW compatible

author: E. Rogers
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2019
review_content: This modem worked great for 8 months then after a move it started dropping the wifi randomly several times a day and reconnecting on its own. Comcast confirmed it is a modem problem. NETGEAR Support wants $140 for a year of support or $50 for a single instance (7 days) of support. Cheaper just to buy a new modem with better support options and better reliability. I don't recommend this modem or Netgear in general after this episode.
title: Stopped being reliable after 8 months, tech support is expensive

author: S. hood
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2019
review_content: I tried several modems before settling on this one and the best part was the CM1200 killed the other modems in connection tests and ease of setup. If you have or are thinking of getting gigabit internet, then you need this modem.Models I tried:Arris SB8200Netgear CM1000I had an SB8200 and it died on me right after setting up my new service. But now I take it as a blessing since I now have the CM1200 and am very happy with it.
title: I tried several modems looking for the best one for gigabit connection

author: wittmayer777
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2019
review_content: Read the fine print, this modem ONLY works using one Ethernet port. While it has 4 ports and mentions that they are "4 x 1G Ethernet ports" only one actually works. The picture hints at this by showing only one yellow Ethernet cord going to the router. Not sure when or if Netgear will actually turn on the others! Had to buy a switch for the other needed connections. Buy the CM1000 that comes with one port and save over a $100!Cost me a Comcast house call to figure it all out.
title: Works great BUT!!!!!!!

author: Billy BoneZ
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 17, 2019
review_content: After wanting to up my internet speed and invest in a new higher speed modem and router, I put together a great group of components only to be arguing with Comcast for months.  Well today I had yet another service call into Comcast, they understood my frustration and came out on St. Patrick's Day.  Luck of the Irish fixed my issues. The Netgear Modem listed as compatible with Comcast has been the problem all along.  I simply aske Comcast to try one of their modems and BINGO All worked flawlessly and with amazing speed.  I never suspected Amazon or Netgear to falsely advertise this product.  And it's too late to return the Modem....  I rarely, if ever write a negative review
title: This has been an absolute Nightmare between Comcast & Me

author: Roadside
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2018
review_content: After receiving a few messages from Comcast that it was time to upgrade my cable modem, I bought this.  My old modem capped out at 130 mbps.  After a very simple set up and validating my Comcast account I was back in business.  Speed jumped up to 160 mbps.  I bought new Cat 7 cable and the speed jumped up again to 185 mbps.  Now when Comcast gets Gigbit service in my area, I'm ready.
title: Faster Speeds

author: Carlos
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2020
review_content: Bought this modem to get gig speed internet. Setup directly to my PC, got Unidentified network error. Rebooted router, it connected but connection was dropping constantly. Factory reset it, and back to unidentified network. Disconnected all cables, and FINALLY the modem was working fine...for 3 days. Now it doesn't connect to the internet at all! Connected my old router back and it works flawlessly. No this is not a user error, yes I know it does not route and that it is a modem only. No I did not try using link aggregation, it was simplistic configuration - modem to PC. This modem is just a manufacturing flaw. Stay away and save your self hours of troubleshooting with your ISP and Netgear support.
title: STAY AWAY!!! Modem seems to have design flaw.

author: Tempting Reviews
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2019
review_content: Mostly plug and play.  Did not come with a coax cable which was depressing. Sleds are as expected.For Comcast, when they added the modem to the account, it stopped working properly; basically wouldn't send signal to my router. Comcast techs were clueless, but since I used to work in high speed internet, I remembered some of my old tricks and got things working. Took a full factory reset, so if that happens to you, try a factory reset of the modem. Not sure why it was needed in this case.
title: Gets the job done but some Comcast issues

author: 0x00000000:00000000
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 14, 2018
review_content: I have Cox Internet service in Southern California: "INTERNET ULTIMATE 300", which promises speeds up to 300 Mbps download, and 30 Mbps upload.  I used Google web search with the phrase "internet speed test" to find several different speed test web pages.  The top result was Google's own widget (using "M-Lab").  I also tried "speedtest.com" and the speed test page offered by Cox Communications.  I used those three speed test sites, and many others.  I tested in two different VirtualBox virtual machines: Windows XP SP3 and Ubuntu 17.10.1 (Linux).  (I avoid web browsing directly in my host OS for most sites.) Because I did the tests in VMs, the speeds might be somewhat lower than if the tests were conducted in the host OS.  The peak download speed I observed was 348 Mbps (~5:30 A.M. PDT, 40 miles to server), and the peak upload speed I observed was 35 Mbps (for many cities, up to 2,800 miles), with latency of 9-12 ms for servers within 40 miles.  However, in late evening, download speeds within 40 miles were generally in the 160 to 200 Mbps range.I think it is crucial to recognize the dramatic effect of time of day and the day of the week, and also the distance to the server which is being used for the internet speed test.  Some speed test sites enable the user to select servers in different cities, and I think it is important to repeat tests with different cities to see just how important distance (and, implicitly, network hops) is for download speed, upload speed, latency, and jitter.This modem enabled me to achieve download and upload speeds notably higher than the maximum speeds promised by Cox for my service tier (300 Mbps download, 30 Mbps upload).  So, my ISP service tier is the limiting factor.I feel compelled to mention that a few isolated internet speed test runs performed relatively poorly -- like a single instance of a download speed of 60 Mbps (slow!), ten seconds after a result of 160 Mbps, and twenty seconds before a result of 194 Mbps.  These isolated slow test runs are uncommon and random; and, so, it is important to repeat tests several times to make sure that incidental connection issues, which have nothing to do with the cable modem or "last-mile" ISP link, are recognized.I did many test runs from a Linux VM to a server within 40 miles, and all download speeds exceeded 319 Mbps, and routinely hit 346+ Mbps, around 5:30 A.M. local time, notably faster than the 300 Mbps promised by my ISP service tier.One final note: Although disconnecting my previous cable modem, and connecting the NETGEAR CM1000, was sufficient to access the Cox "cable modem activation" web page, their web page encountered an error, and I was forced to call Cox on the phone to complete activation (with modem serial number and MAC address).  It took several "reset" commands from Cox before they detected the modem, and a couple of power cycles, all during the phone call, before it worked.  Now, I am very pleased with the speed, and it is tempting to upgrade to Cox's Gigablast tier.
title: Exceeds Cox "Ultimate" (300Mbps down, 30Mbps up) speeds

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2020
review_content: I purchased this modem in February when I upgraded to Xfinity service with 1Gbps.  It worked fine at first, but over a couple months  we started noticing Netflix and Prime Video would stop.  Problems got more frequent  until I called Netgear support in May, shortly before the warranty expired. The problem didn’t get resolved, and I naïvely bought their Pro Support plan so that I could try to recover my investment over the next month. Problems continued to become more frequent, and rebooting the modem would solve them. Now in July the high packet loss rate and occasional entire hang is not always being resolved by the reboot. I spent five hours (mostly on hold), and Netgear said Comcast had to make a change. I called Comcast and they said the setting needed to be changed inside the modem. So I called Netgear support again the next day and once they got my case number then while I was explaining the problem the line went dead but didn’t drop. I called back and the same thing happened again. I gave up, wondering whether it was a tactic to avoid replacing my modem. I ordered an Xfinity rental modem today so at least there can’t be any more finger pointing. Don’t  waste your money on this modem and especially not on Netgear ProSupport.
title: Stay away from Netgear

author: Rick
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 18, 2020
review_content: The description says "all cable providers".  Don't believe it.  It refused to interface with WOW, and I went back to my very good 5 yr old Motorola.  This thing simply wouldn't connect.
title: Beware

author: juan ramirez
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2019
review_content: Used this for an xfinity account.I did not follow the instructions.All I did was u plug the router. Connected the modem and let it sit 10 minutes. Once all lights turned green. I hooked it to the router and powered that on.Let it sit for a couple of minutes and go on my laptop. Opened a browser and it all connected automatically. Sent me to a xfinity activation page and I just followed the instructions.All in all, super easy to install. I didn’t have to talk to anyone. Did it all automatically.As far as the speed, it’s amazing, and runs like a beast.
title: Works with xfinity

author: rtk11226
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2020
review_content: Took a full 8 hours with SUDDENLINK tech support to get it configured. I’m sure it was NOT the fault of the modem since It came highly recommended by a contractor for SUDDENLINK.  After 2 months in service, no issues. Don’t forget to take the old modem back immediately since they don’t stop the rental fee until they receive the old one.
title: Great modem

author: Elvis J. Nelson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2020
review_content: Every couple of weeks all of a sudden this expensive modem stops working. No internet connection. I tried to blame Spectrum, the internet provider, but their records show no break in signal to the modem. Rebooting or resetting did not work. It works well for a while, then boom, no worky. I suspect it was a refurbished unit as the price was reduced $30. Seems like if it failed, it would all the time. Since we work from home, internet service is critical. I have been a Netgear user for many years, but this is inexcusable.
title: Product Failed

author: Clouds Wind Mist
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 29, 2020
review_content: I have been using a Motorola Arris Surfboard modem that has served me well. Its case is soft white plastic in a matte finish that does not break or become scratched when knocked over. The Netgear modem that is the subject of this review is made of hard, shiny black plastic that is easily scratched and could easily chip or crack if the modem falls over. Also, it is very easy to knock over possibly because its base is too small to stabilize it. I cannot comment on its functionality.
title: The case is hard, shiny black plastic (not built to last)

author: Katbird
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 2, 2019
review_content: This may be my first negative review on Amazon. I bought this router because my internet provider said I needed to upgrade.I experience random blackouts of service with this unit that were never a problem with my old device. Some interruptions to service last about a minute, others last close to 5. There is no rhythm or reason to when and why. There is also no noticeable or measurable speed or performance increase over the 5 year old cable modem I was using.
title: Garage

author: Till R.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 12, 2020
review_content: Installed within 10 minutes - without calling Comcast - just using the included quick start guide, this modem is up fast and has no problem handling our 660-700mbit/s service. I love the fact that it has no WiFi, no interference with our whole house WiFi.....also very little heat emission. All around great.
title: Fast and easy to install

author: Bob
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 7, 2019
review_content: This is not a router. I thought I’d be able to use all four LAN connections. I tried to run four LAN cables out to separate rooms with a separate  WiFi router in another room. No good. Basically I could only get a signal to one device at a time depending on which device was plugged in and turned on first. If I turned on the second WiFi router first, nothing else would get a signal. If I turned on my desktop first, only it would get a signal.  I got some help with install and we learned that this is not a router. That is the only reason I am docking one star from my rating. Once we came up with a solution to use only one of the LAN connections, this thing works great. Super fast future proof and is saving me $12 from renting from my isp.
title: Not a router

author: John M Roberson
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 7, 2020
review_content: As many other reviewers have mentioned, only the first ethernet port works. This should be shared widely and it is not. That being said, we upgraded to Xfinity gigabit service and this will pass 1Gb through the ethernet port. I'm using a Ubiquity Dream Machine and my wife's newer Macbook Pro easily gets 800mbs down on wifi and my older Macbook Pro gets 600mbs down. Hardwired, all machines get the full 1Gbs.
title: Full gigabit speed

author: LC
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2018
review_content: We recently switched over to WOW for our Internet. I didn't want to rent a modem from the company since those costs add up quickly, so I went searching for one that was compatible. I was a little confused about whether this model would work or not since some of the numbers were different than the list WOW provided. Amazon's employee was helpful and said it would work, and the price was right, so I gave it a try.Installation couldn't have been easier. I had it hooked up within minutes, and it worked right away. The signal strength isn't great in some areas of my home, but this modem is a great value for the price. I'll make up my money compared to rental fees within just a few months.
title: Works with WOW

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2020
review_content: I only provided four stars due to the fact when it arrived, there was nothing sealing the box so the contents could have been taken in and out during the whole shipping process.As for the actual modem, I think it's an excellent buy for the price. Everything that was needed to come with the modem, did, and it was a quick and easy installation.  Less than 5 minutes to replace my old modem.I needed to upgrade as I play online games and stream so I went with this modem. I've only had it for a couple days and I haven't had one issue out of it.  Performs great and I would recommend this if you're going to be gaming or using a lot of data.
title: Well worth the money-xbox and streaming

author: Lovelearn
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2020
review_content: It is a good modem but it gets really hot after a while on. I have to turn it on and off to reset it. In the beginning, it was just a unplug and plug and it will come back to life immediately. However, after two years now, it will get super hot and even if I unplug and plug in, it will not work. I am looking for an replacement now. I am not sure how long the item should last but two year seems a bit short. Also, warranty expired in a year.
title: it gets extremely hot after 1 years

author: Veronica Oliveira
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2019
review_content: UPDATE: has worked well last 6 monthsWe have a TV that used 5G for Fire TV Stick, 5G for XBox one, 2.4G for up to 4 phones and (old) notepad, & 5G for a laptop. We had tech support help me set everything up with Modem and new WiFi... They were a great help/However, I purchased a 4 year warranty to cover both NETGEAR unit with Tech Support for the reason I have a funny feeling we will need further assistance as the Xfinity internet provider, Modem and WiFi Router are updated in times (as usual).
title: Modem Works Great with our new NETGEAR WiFi Router

author: Cis
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 8, 2020
review_content: Neither me nor my 21 year old helper nor my son could get this going with Xfinity.  I spent hours on the phone with Xfinity and Netgear, all to no avail.  Also, I'm so slow I didn't know I'd ordered one that had to be cable connected.  I did ordera  wifi rounter, but sent it all back because no one could get it to work, even the Netgear tech.  He couldn't even remote in to figure out the problem.
title: Returned

author: MCT
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 2, 2018
review_content: Setup was super easy, but requires a 10 minute call to Comcast to add the modem’s MAC address in their system.  After that, it’s all ready to go.  The modem itself is a lot smaller than it looks in the pictures, which is nice.  However, the stand is kind of flimsy and the unit is very light, causing it to be pretty unstable on the desk with all the cords attached.  Be aware that this is on the list of Puma 6 modems that are not recommended.  Do some research and maybe look at alternatives.  I haven’t seen any issues yet.  My speed didn’t increase with this modem.  If anything, it’s slower than the 1gig capable modem from Comcast, but at least I’m free from the $11/month charge.
title: Good modem, be aware of Puma 6 chipset

author: TechDev
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2019
review_content: Did not like this modem at all.  It was not hard to get setup.  I have setup many Access points, Routers, Switches, Networks etc... so I would say my knowledge is above average on the equipment.  The PROBLEM with this MODEM is its DURABILITY and RELIABILITY.  At least 1-2 times each month - this MODEM needs to be REBOOTED.  Additionally, even worse, after buying this BRAND NEW - it only LASTED 7 months.  Now the MAX speed coming through the MODEM is 38mbp speed (used to be 180+mbp)  tried many resets, restarts) - Put in my OLD SPARE modem and everything running like normal again (using old SB6121).  I would NOT RECOMMEND this MODEM
title: NOT Very RELIABLE or DURABLE at ALL

author: gurureview
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2018
review_content: I called Comcast to replace Comcast rental modem and they told me that this modem was already associated with another account. I said how can this be as I just bought this off Amazon and paid full price? After an hour on the phone with Comcast Tier 2 support they said they could not add the modem and that I would have to take it to a Comcast store 30 minutes away. Not happy at all I did so and they told me the same thing and that they could not add modem and I should return the used item.
title: New Modem already associated with another Comcast account.

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 23, 2020
review_content: We started seeing issues within the first year, where we would constantly have to restart it every other week or so. Now, within the last 6 months, we have had to reset it about every other day. We have confirmed several times that it is not an issue with our internet provider (xfinity). While things aren't all bad, it did pay for itself as oppose to renting a modem, but just know it has issues.
title: Troubled Modem after 1 year of use

author: Ankit
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2020
review_content: It worked just fine, and stopped working intermittently after a month. Called my ISP, and there is no connection issue from their side which makes sense because this modem starts working every time after a restart.Called amazon, but they can't replace it after a month window. Now I have to chase down Netgear and ask them to replace/refund me.This has wasted so much time and energy of mine. I am working from home and getting disconnected in between my meetings.DON"T BUY THIS FAULTY PRODUCT
title: It STOPPED working after a Month

author: Amazon Customer
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2019
review_content: I should have read the reviews. Like so many others, mine failed within 4 months. I called support , but since I was right outside the "90 day phone support" window the rep refused to help me unless I subscribe to at a minimum a 6 month support agreement for $120, even though my product was still under warranty. I tried to explain to him that this was unreasonable since I can just buy another brand new modem for under $60 but he was not having any of that. It's cheaper to toss this thing in the garbage and buy a new modem. These shady practices will prevent me from buying any Netgear products again. I'll buy from a vendor who honor their warranty without strings attached. I would recommend a Surfboard modem instead, I had one for years and never had an issue with it.
title: Never buying Netgear again

author: Andrew Tran
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2020
