review_content: I recently moved to an area with cable ISPs only (no more Fios for me) so I begrudgingly looked for a good cable modem to add to my networking equipment. Since I was getting Gigabit with RCN, I had to have a 32x8 DOCSIS 3.1 modem, and the issue with PUMA 6 chipset make it so that the choices are rather limited. I bought the CM1000 when it was on sale for about $100. So far after running it for 2 months I must say it definitely works very well. My connection is stable, and I do get the full speeds I'm paying for. I'd definitely recommend pairing this with a good router. Your ISP's modem+router combo boxes can't compete with a high performing modem and router setup.
title: CM1000 - Great modem and does its job well!

author: review
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2020
review_content: In the same boat as others, 3 month and CM500 started acting up.Sporadically drops the connection and requires a reset. Today had to reset it 4 times just to be able to browse the internet.Quality of the connection has also went down, calls over the net became unbearable, issues with latency, extra noise and packet drop.This is a common issue, which means it is very likely to happen to you.At this point, best Amazon can do is to try to negotiate with Netgear for a replacement...wish i have read the comments :(
title: 3 month and kaput

author: Wayne Dutton
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 23, 2020
review_content: The first modem arrived not working, spent considerable time on the phone with cable provider who could not get it to sync with the network. They advised I call netgear CS, after being on hold for extended period I decided to send it back and Amazon CS processed a return and covered overnight shipping for another one from netgear store. Second one work perfectly out of the box. 5 Stars for the device once working.
title: Had to order a 2nd unit

author: Bethany
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2019
review_content: This router was great. High quality, easy setup and strong signal.I bought this router specifically because it was recommended by multiple VPN services that said it was compatible. The model I had was correct and said it was made in Vietnam.It was not compatible at all. I even hired a professional company to flash the VPN onto it and they couldn't do it.If you are looking for a VPN compatible router get the Linksys instead. It did a great job.
title: Not VPN compatible

author: Costa
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on November 24, 2020
review_content: I have had this Modem since January 2020, As soon as I had it provisioned had gigabit speed’s immediately and I have had no problems whatsoever with the modem itself, I have near continuous speeds usually ranging between 650 Mb to 950Mb per second. Only minor gripes, Wish it had an option for wall mounting, or the option to lay it down flat, for rack mounting. Other than that, a solid modem, for those wanting to not have an all in one device, great choice
title: Near Perfect

author: James
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 8, 2018
review_content: I have Comcast Xfinity Blast service. I purchased an Arris Surfboard SB8200 modem which I tried to use for 3 weeks.  It kept locking up on me and required a hard (power cycle) reboot to reset it.  I returned it to Amazon (thank you!) and purchased a Netgear CM1000 modem.  It has worked solid for the past month without a single problem. The Netgear CM1000 works, that is what counts.
title: The Docsis 3.1 modem that works.

author: abudebbie
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2019
review_content: I don’t have a computer. Only phones and tablets. You NEED a router with this modem if you want to have WiFi. Spent hours on the phone trying to get it to work with the xfinity customer service. Useless. Modem showed up on WiFi as an option on my phone but needed a password. Nowhere in the box or on the modem itself is there a network password. Called up Netgear and even after waiting on hold for around 40 mins the problem was fixed in about 10-15 mins. I ended up just having to reconfigure the router for the new modem. Easy once I knew what to do.
title: Works fine.

author: ASan
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2018
review_content: Replaced an older Surfboard modem that was dropping connection a few times a day with this. So far it's been running for a couple weeks and hasn't dropped signal once. Set up was really easy, just replace connections from older modem with this one and you're good to go. Speeds are consistent and fast. The modem does run a bit hot compared to my older SB modem, but no complaints so far. I have a netgear nighthawk router running in tandem with this and they seem to work well together.
title: Great Modem!

author: Russ
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 3, 2020
review_content: I bought this modem to replace an older Spectrum modem that I had been renting from them, I’m sure glad I did! I have been  paying for a 200 mb connection as I have multiple smart home devices, TV’s phones, tablets and the like, with the older modem I could barely reach 80-90 mb download speeds, the TV’s were always buffering, it was very frustrating, after multiple tech support calls to Spectrum with no resolution on the speed of the modem, and a bit of research, I decided to buy the Netgear CM 500, I installed it, called Spectrum and I was up and running in minutes.The difference in the speed of this modem to the old one was immediately noticeable, my TV’s looked crisper, the menus loaded instantly and the frustrating buffering was completely gone. My download speeds went from 80mb to 200mb, I highly recommend this modem if you looking to upgrade.
title: Incredible speed!

author: J. Brooks
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2020
review_content: It replaced a Netgear CM600 so we could take better advantage of Gigabit throughput.  Does exactly what we needed it to do, good high-speed bandwidth, solid and reliable performance.  Also really like it has ethernet ports directly built into it so I can hardwire our home PC to the internet without filtering it through our router.
title: Reliable Uninterrupted Data Throughput All Day Long

author: David A Torode
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2018
review_content: 09-02-18 - It wasn’t packed in a box. Just in its retail box as it’s own item. Beyond that once I took it out of the box I knew there was something wrong when all I could hear was metal sliding around inside of the router when I moved it around. Best guess? Heat sink fell off the board. Returned for new one. Hopefully it comes in working order and I can Ammend this review to have a higher rating. Either way the Comcast guy is here in a few days and if the next one is also bad I’m kind of screwed.
title: Not shipped in a box. Arrived damaged.

author: Cindy
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 4, 2018
review_content: This modem has solved my internet connection issues. It has replaced an Arris SB6190, which I had nothing but problems with (the SB6190 would drop internet connections with WAVE frequently, causing me to have to reboot the darn thing all the time. I guess that Puma chip was to blame).The new Netgear CM1000 has proven to be stable, fast and error free. While I'm not using anywhere near it's gigabit speed potential (I'm on a 100 Mbps plan) it does scream along with my current speed showing not even a hiccup. Speed test confirm I'm getting slightly higher than 100 down, and a little higher than 5 up. This thing ALMOST makes me want to upgrade to a higher speed, with the knowledge that I know it can easily handle it. I've not had a single dropped connection in the week I've had it so far with WAVE since switching, which says a lot considering how many times I would have had to reboot the Arris (almost daily).Setup was super simply - I just called WAVE and gave them the mac address. A few minutes later and it connected right up. No worries at all. It also talks flawlessly with my new MR500 Netgear router. Between the two, call me impressed.
title: Solved my internet connection issues

author: maga!!
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2019
review_content: just to be clear call xfinity before you buy!!!  this modem does NOT work with their voice lines..-7 to 7+ is about the only range this modem will work in. .5 higher or lower it crashes the router . Then it locks up.tech support is a joke email only no return calls nothing. One email stating it was an xfinity issue and the dropped me ..
title: research alot before you buy!!!

author: ST
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 16, 2020
review_content: Just got this USED from Amazon Warehouse for 170.00.  Take it out installed per manual.  I could not get it to activated online after Physically hook up.  Call  Xfinity, they have to do it on their end to reset the modem twice and 15 minutes later it is up and running.  I plug the LAN cable to my Router and everything work as it should.  No different in speed vs the Xfinity Modem.  Glad I got this good deal for 170.00
title: Good for the Price.  Easy setup.

author: E.E.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on July 12, 2020
review_content: I bought this to replace my ISP's cable modem and avoid monthly fees.  For that it worked perfectly.  I unplugged the old one, plugged in this new one, and followed the instructions.  After everything powered up, I called my service provider and gave them the new modem's ID#.  That was two weeks ago and the WIFi has been flawless.  Minus one star because 1) the vertical design is not very steady, and 2) the indicator light are microscopic and not very bright.  You can only really see the colors if you are looking directly at the side of the case in a dark room.
title: Works Well, But Indicator Lights Almost Invisible

author: Jeremy B. Baker
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2019
review_content: It worked for less than three hours. I bought this modem to replace a good working cable company-owned modem that was connected to a wireless router. This set-up had worked fine together for over two years. The new modem was setup properly with the cable company and was working great, but crashed for no obvious reason. It was hot when it quit. Tried everything to get it back online, spent over an hour trying without success. Got the old cable company-owned modem back up and was connected to internet, but soon realized that whatever happened fried the router too.
title: Must have got a dud..

author: M. Loomis
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2019
review_content: Had to upgrade from a previous one in the same Netgear series, as it was rated up to only 500Mbits and my new service supports 1Gbit.  I made sure to verify that this model did indeed work with Comcast.  As usual the swap was easy as you simply phone tech support and tell them that you have a new modem.  Once they get the make, model, serial and MAC address you're good to go.  I have had zero issues thus far.  Definitely recommended.
title: Easy setup

author: H. Cooper
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2018
review_content: I bought this modem (CM1000) to work with Comcast gigabit internet. It works, but at about 30-80Mbps. I've been running speed tests for a week, and 90 was the highest I got.I had Comcast support update the firmware, check the device, and no luck.As an experiment, I swapped the modem out for my old Arris Surfboard DOCSIS 3.0 modem, and immediately got 3x-5x faster speeds (still slower than gigabit, but better than this modem).I've never had good luck with Netgear products, and this is no better.
title: Didn't work with Comcast gigabit

author: Anthony
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2019
review_content: Basically all NightHawk series modems and routers are top notch but if you are planning on using 2 modems and paying for one internet service you better check with your provider if using 2 modems is prohibited. Yes, its fully supported by comcast/xfinity but you have to ditch your current modem and things get more complicated if your current modem is a data voice modem. Don't get excited with the big seal on the from that says fully compatible with xfinity though if you are replacing a data modem with this one I believe it would be a great choice.
title: Warning! Do not buy if your planning on using it as a second modem

author: ANM
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on August 24, 2019
review_content: This was not compatible with xfinity according to my xfinity employee setting my system up.  The sales person at xfinity gave me this as one to buy but it didn’t work. This may be more an issue with xfinity than with this product as xfinity’s explanations didn’t make sense. And more expensive one bought at wal mart with advertised compatability with xfinity also didn’t work. Now I am stuck leasing one with xfinity and now left with this purchase that is useless. I would not buy this or any other one for use with xfinity without absolutely getting written recommendations and guarantees from xfinity.
title: Not compatible with xfinity according to xfinity

author: J. Shays
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2018
review_content: I purchased this back in January, and I haven't had any issues with it yet. The modem does run a little warm. When I first received it and plugged it in, it was very warm to the touch, but after a few hours it seemed to go down and return to "normal".I can't really comment on whether or not this increased any speed, I went from Centurylink to Zito in our area, could barely get 7mbs with Centurylink and their dsl.. so we switched to the only other provider in my area and got 50mbs, they're not well known for their reliability, but I have been getting 40-48mbs with this modem. Others I know who have the same service generally get 20-35mbs, so could be the modem.I got this when it was on sale, so fairly cheap, would recommend buying then and not at full price (like with anything lol), but if you're in desperate need for one, I like this one a lot and do recommend it. It's not bulky, it's slim, can easily hide in a corner.
title: Good Slim, Sleek Modem.

author: Andi S.
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on June 21, 2020
review_content: This is the first time I use Xfinity and not sure which modem will work. I am on 200 MB plan, but want to get a modem that will allow to expand if I were to change the speed. I checked several modems brand and model. Finally set my decision to Netgear CM500, it does not disappoint, it allows up to 600 mb download speed. I pair this CM500 with Orbi Wifi Mesh and I get the best of this combination. I constantly get around 230s download speed and 5-6 upload speed.
title: Netgear CM500 on Xfinity

author: Ront
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2019
review_content: MY FINAL PROBLEM IS THIS UNIT IS JUST BAD, ONE UNIT WAS SENT BACK BECAUSE IT HAD SOMETHING ROLLING AROUND IN IT, THE OTHER UNIT JUST QUIT AFTER A YEAR, I HAVE A OLDER 700 NETGEAR THAT I REINSTALLED AND IT WORKED FINE,AND THE SUPPORT TRIED BUT IN THE END THEY JUST TRIED TO BLAME THE INTERNET SERVICE. MY FINAL COMMENT IS LOOK AROUND BEFORE YOU BUY THIS MODEM.
title: THESE UNITS ARE BUGGY

author: D. Bevis
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on December 14, 2020
review_content: Replaced my leased Cable Company router with the CM 1000v2.  Great support from NETGEAR support, but going to my Cable Provider for registration and set up was the key to success.  Works great.  Recommend to others.
title: Great Product, Performance Matches the Brag

author: Bill
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on September 21, 2020
review_content: I bought this modem to upgrade from the previous modem that I also bought from Amazon. The problem with this new modem is that it doesn't work. You can't find the network connection on my computer screen. I have Mediacom as a network carrier and he tried talking to the modem as they usually do and there was no sign of life. I will be trying a different Amazon seller for my upgraded modem.
title: First time I bought a modem from Amazon that doesn't work

author: S.Will
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2020
review_content: After having 2 Arris Surfboard SB6183 Modems never connect to our ISP Cox Cable properly, apparently the Intel Puma chip in those modems has been an issue for quite some time,  we ordered the Netgear CM500(no Puma chip in this model). Thus far our installation and integration with our ASUS router has been seamless. I would recommend this modem for any Cox subscriber having issues. I will update if anything goes awry with this modem.
title: Stay Connected!
